Nobody will follow you just because you have some nice pictures (of course, it’s kind of obvious prerequisite to even start the whole thing). People should also get know about you and feel that you are of some interest to them. So, you need to 1) find your target and then 2) let them notice you. You get their attention when you interact on their content in a human-like way. Simply liking some photos rarely helps, you’d better leave the comment that proves that you are a real person yourself (no generic “It’s awesome!” or emoji shit, take some time and effort to master a custom message that shows why you appreciate both commented photo and entire feed of the person). Conversion on this method is close to 25% (my own observation) if you make good analysis on your target audience. Now, the numbers. If you have your own algorithm to quickly find potential followers, going through their feeds and interacting on their content might take 3–5 minutes. In half an hour you can show true attention to 6–10 people. Let’s say 25% of them would follow you back - it means 2 real followers “farmed” in 1/2-hour “sprint”. Have two of such sprints a day, and you’ll get 4 new real followers. If you do outstanding work to find potential followers and are able to write very good comments, you can boost the conversion to 50%. If your own feed is truly amazing and/or you already have a great followers/following ratio, it also helps. But if you just started, prepare to go the hard way until your Instagram karma starts working in your favour. Now sit back and think whether you want spending that much time of yours to boost some numbers that only slightly massage your ego and otherwise bring nothing for you. You can hire people to do this work for you. Let’s say you find someone to “farm” followers for you using the technique I described, and you pay them $10/hour. Then, 100 new real followers would cost you 5+ hours, meaning $50+. Growth is always exponential. The more followers you already have, the faster growth is. This means that reaching the phase of sustainable growth would require quite some time. If you only care about numbers, go the fast way and bring your $$$ to all those little agencies that would boost your numbers, just don’t expect any quality in this kind of following.

Gaining followers doesn’t have to be hard if you play the game. The best way to learn is to observe those that have already figured it out… influencers! Regardless of niche, influencers have 3 things in common: They create a developed, unique editorial style.They represent a niche and leverage it consistently.They are community management experts!True, it might not sound easy at first but once you get a hang of these three things, followers will be coming to you. Here are some (actionable) tips to help you get started:  Balance promotional, educational, and entertainment/ inspiration posts. (This is called the 1/3 rule to posting.)Take advantage of the free tools out there to schedule & design your posts. (Buffer, Later, etc.)Establish your niche. This is crucial because there’s so many users out there and you want to stand out. (For example, imagine you like “cooking”; that’s really broad. Are you vegan? cooking desserts? cooking on a budget?? This is what defining your niche looks like.)Then use those keywords. Once you’ve established your niche, then stick to it and use relevant industry keywords in your bio, your posts, hashtags (but not too many, it looks desperate.) This will bring coherency to your posting which attracts followers and…brands!Collaborate with relevant brands! Doing reviews is a great way. It’s all about creating mutual value.Transparency. If you are going to be working with brands, always prioritize transparent relationships for your sake and theirs.Vary your content types and don’t neglect video!Run giveaways, contests, or other creative engagement boosters.Quality over quantity when it comes to posting.Engage your community: Always respond to comments, shares, and inquiries.Passion. You cannot force influence, it builds around people that are providing something valuable or entertaining. You’re much more likely to succeed in this area if you’re invested in what you’re doing. It’s called authenticity. Brands take note of this, as well.What NOT to do? Buy followers or fake engagement. This drives away real followers and guarantees no genuine engagement on your posts. (More on that here.)  Answer based on my experience running an influencer marketing software company called Upfluence. We use advanced technology to help brands find the right influencers for their campaigns. Hope this helps and thanks for A2A! Vivien

If you just starting to learn how to get followers on Instagram, this tactics is best for beginners. Some Instagram newbies have seen their Instagram followers increase fast. I will share some tips and strategies on how you can start gaining followers pretty quickly. Just like Twitter, your bio on Instagram is there for the world to see. You only have room to write 150 characters in your bio, so you can’t go crazy in this section. Remember that what you write in your bio and your tone should reflect the brand you’re creating or solidifying. If you’re a professional business or business professional then let your bio reflect that. I know that it can be tempting to use Emojis in your bio, but unless you’re creating it for personal use only, try and leave them out. Emojis and strange fonts aren’t all that great looking and tend to give a sort of spammy impression that can hurt your follower count. Some beginners like to join Instagram engagement groups, there are plenty of them: travel, beauty, fashion, fitness and etc. While it can be tempting to join the biggest Instagram engagement groups, the truth is you’ll get a more targeted list of Instagram followers by sticking to your niche. In these groups, you can get followers and likes from people who have shared interests. But if you’re serious about getting the attention, you should also return the favour by following fan pages for people who join the group. When you’re just about to post an image with Instagram, there is a set of social buttons that allows you to post both in Instagram and then to social accounts like Tumblr, Facebook and Twitter. You can connect your desired accounts and selectively post pictures to them. But doing this allows people to see that you post directly from Instagram. They can click on the picture and get taken back to your profile where they can easily follow you. This can help collect your following from your separate social channels under one roof where they can get to know you or your brand a little better. Follow people who like competing pages. To get that Instagram followers increase you need to find people who follow brands. Who are your biggest competitors on Instagram? Write them down. Then, browse their posts to see who’s commenting on their posts. Follow them and engage with them. Keep in mind that when choosing competitors on Instagram it’s better to go for the smaller brands. Why? Because if you were selling makeup brushes and trying to get people who comment on Sephora, there’s a good chance that they’re not the right audience despite being in a similar niche. Bigger brands tend to have more customer loyalty. Before you post your first picture, you’ll want to nail down who you want to engage. If you’re a mom blogger looking to gain followers for your blog, then your target market is more than likely going to be other moms. Therefore, whatever image and corresponding description you post should have a bend towards that. (i.e. elegant, feminine, helpful, cute, informative, etc.) However, if you’re a fitness trainer, then your market is likely going to be those interested in healthy living which can coverages ranging from younger people too much older ones — both male and female. Your posts should still reflect your message, and posts with inspirational quotes can be a big help when growing your follower base. Whatever you plan to do on Instagram, knowing who it is that you’re trying to attract as followers will help you to post more effectively.

Firstly let me clarify that the importance people and brands place on follower counts or the impressions their content receives is grossly overvalued. I can’t say numbers don’t matter, but the value everyone places on these numbers needs to be reconsidered. There is just too much emphasis on the width of engagement—how many potential connections they make—rather than the depth of those interactions which, in my eyes, is far more important. It doesn’t matter if you have an Instagram account with a million followers or if you just created a new profile today, this is absolutely the advice I would give to anyone looking to build a more meaningful community on Instagram or online. The reason I feel comfortable answering this question is that I’ve spent the last 10 years of my career trying to understand user psychology and reverse engineer attention into an engaged community online. This is not theory, it’s practical advice that has worked for me and thousands of other individuals, companies, products, and brands. I started using these tactics on Twitter but obviously migrated them to Facebook and Instagram. No matter which platform comes next, this will be the behavior I deploy to build awareness, and more importantly, community online. The truth is, the way to win on social media is to actually be social! The number of Instagram followers you have means nothing if you can’t build a community of like-minded people who care and engage. The only real way to do this from scratch is to become part of the conversation, you need to participate and engage with people who have the same interests as you. I came up with what I like to call the $1.80 Instagram strategy which translates to leaving your personal $.02 on the top 9 trending Instagram posts for 10 different hashtags that are relevant to your brand or business every single day. By the end, you haven’t just left your $.02, but a full $1.80 of thoughts online in the specific category, niche or industry you want to become a part of. I’m going to use the example of meditation. imagine that you are deep into meditation and have been practicing for years and now you want to build a business around meditation or grow your personal brand. STEP 1: FINDING THE BEST HASHTAGS TO FOLLOW The first thing you need to do is identify the 10 most important/relevant hashtags in your field. The best part about searching for hashtags is that you can quickly and easily identify related tags in your industry or niche. Once you search meditation, Instagram recommends related hashtags to follow. Spend time searching not only the most popular hashtags but lesser known hashtags that still relate and can make a real impact. When you find a hashtag, or better yet a post, the first thing you need to do is identify who that person is. Click on the post, identify the account, read their bio, look at their profile, understand their likes, dislikes, and activity. Read the copy below and engage, even if the account only has 190 followers but every single post that user creates has 60 likes and 20 comments, REACH OUT and leave your $.02. The thought that a low number of followers can be considered “irrelevant” makes no sense to me. You can have 10, 10,000, or 1,000,000 followers and all it takes is for one post to be noticed by one person to cause a social media chain reaction. The absolute number does not matter. One retweet, one repost, one link in an email is enough to get the ball rolling. STEP 2: LEAVE YOUR INSTAGRAM COMMENT $.02 FOR THE 1.80 INSTAGRAM STRATEGY Now that you’ve identified the top 9 posts for your top 10 hashtags… it’s time to leave your $.02 which means leaving your thoughts and trying to provide value where you can. If you see someone in the comments who has a question and you know how to respond, answer. If you love the post and admire the aesthetic, say so! If you have thoughts about the quote or the copy in their post, reply! If the image reminds you of another content creator, tag them. If you think a friend would benefit from seeing it, share it with them. Comment, like, engage, respond, share. These are the simple and easy ways you can leave your $.02. Realistically this shouldn’t take any more than 2 minutes per post. You don’t have to write a book or say something profound, you just have to engage and interact. That is what it means to be social. But please please please be authentic to yourself and the person on that post. We all know what a spam comment looks like. And if you really want to connect, send a DM to the creator. Mention the post and why you liked it. Respond to their story and say something valuable. Ask if you can help, collaborate, promote, etc. STEP 3. CONTINUE TO COMMENT, LIKE AND ENGAGE ON INSTAGRAM It’s as easy as that. The overall process is incredibly simple. It’s $.02 , on 9 posts for 10 hashtags every day. That all adds up to $1.80. No matter how much value you provide, this is still a game of numbers. You have to be willing to give yourself more at-bats. Everyone else is only leaving $.02. You’re leaving a $1.80 Every single day. Even if that is only one new follower a day or 1 new idea about what works and what doesn’t on Instagram. No matter what, I guarantee you will learn. You will learn something about the platform, about culture, about human behavior, about how people interact online, about empathy and humility and perspective, it’s all there through this little process. It’s leaving your $.02 and being part of a real community. So, start deploying the $1.80 strategy. You’re going to drop $1.80 a day, two cents at a time, nine top posts, on ten different hashtags, every day. And that will slowly but surely build an audience that knows you and appreciates your content. You’re going to leave $1.80 in karma, $1.80 in community, $1.80 in your thoughts. You’re not there to say follow, follow, follow. The way to be discovered is to either put out great content, and have one piece go viral, or the way I like it, and the strategy that has always worked for me is to become part of the community. You will pick up three to four followers a day, which are meaningful. Not bots and spam, but meaningful connections. That means you’ll probably receive 100 new meaningful followers in a month. Which means you’ll put out a piece of content and if one of them is special, and one of the people that follow you has a bigger audience and decided to share it, then away you go. But that’s not even the best part. You know what’s so great about the $1.80 Instagram strategy? It’s not that you’re going to get exposure, or you’re going to get some followers, or that you’re going to contribute and be a great community member, but you’re also going to learn. Because you’re going to watch and consume, 90 pieces of content a day that are doing well on Instagram, which is then going to inspire and help you strategize the content that you yourself are going to put out on Instagram. That’s a really good use of three hours a day. Let me know how it goes. If you liked this answer, say hi on: INSTAGRAM | TWITTER | FACEBOOK | SNAPCHAT | ITUNES

I’d like to act all cheerful like all those big accounts are, and tell you that the key to Instagram growth is to consistently post good quality material, but then I’d be lying. There is a lot more involved than simply just those two elements. A lot is going on behind the curtains where you, the followers, can’t see. There is a lot of collaboration going on between big accounts. A lot of deceiver, fraud, etc. There are different types of pages. First, there are the video pages, then, the meme pages, and lastly, the text-based pages. For video pages and meme, it would boil down to these 2 elements: Hitting the Explore pageShoutoutsThe Explore page is that little magnifying glass-looking thingy at the bottom of the screen that when you go to, there are a lot of random pictures and videos from people that you may or may not follow. The way to get on the Explore page is to get a lot of people to like your picture immediately. When a person that you follow likes a picture, it will get recommended to you on your Explore page, typically with the text based on pictures you’ve liked or based on people you follow. The key to getting on the Explore page is to first get a lot of people from the same niche (say, videos and memes) to like your photo. The reason that I say they should be from the same niche is because when a person likes a certain category of things and follows an account within that niche, it is more likely that they would like and follow other content from that niche too. So, say, if someone follows an account called Viral Videos and there is another account called Viral Content and another one called Flowers and Pottery, they are more likely to follow Viral Content if they already follow Viral Video. In order to get the necessary amount of likes to hit the Explore page, you have to do something. It’s very rare that, suddenly, a lot of people from the same niche as you would start liking your content without expecting anything in return for that. For that reason, there is a concept called “likes groups” which is basically a lot of people from the same niche creating a group and asking the other ones to like and comment on their posts, and, in return, they will like and comment on the other person’s post too. You can also do this through DMs, it doesn’t necessarily have to be a group. When a post hits Explore, it will be seen by a lot more people than the number of people who follow you. About shoutouts — shoutouts are basically when a person tells their followers to go and follow a certain account, usually in the same niche as the first account. In order to get a shoutout, you either haver to give the other person a shoutout too, or pay them money. You have to negotiate on that. However, for text-based accounts, it’s a whole different story. These are the tricks for text-based accounts: Follow for followComment for followLike for followShoutoutsFollow for follow basically means that you go and follow a lot of people from the same niche as you, and since your username is usually fitting to your niche and they are interested in that niche, they will come and follow you in return for your follow. Following them does not serve a purpose for you, other than the fact that you want to get recognized by the people you follow, who might be interested in your content, and would follow you back. Comment for follow is a bit harder and more time-taking. It’s basically follow for follow, but instead of following the person to get their attention, you comment on their recent post/s. Like for follow should be obvious by now. And you already know what shoutouts are, and how you can get them. The reason that hitting the Explore page does not work on text-based accounts is because Instagram’s algorithms basically do not allow it. I don’t know why, but that is what I have gotten from the experience of myself and other big and semi-big accounts. Yes, of course, there are other accounts in the niche of photography, music, etc, but (ironically) they are not as mainstream as entertainment accounts, and I don’t really know much about them. Hope this helps!

response.answer_text: Today i will tell you how to get more followers on Instagram.  1. Share Images People Can Relate To If you check out the most popular Instagram accounts, you’ll notice a common theme. All of their photos are something most people can relate to and connect with. They’re personal, unique, and original. By sharing these types of photos, you’re establishing a connection with your audience, which is the absolute best way to attract people to your account. In short, make sure your Instagram account is authentic and original. 2. Post at the Right Time Before posting anything onto Instagram, consider what time zone the majority of your audience lives in and what time they check their Instagram account. Because of its mobility, there isn’t really a favorite time for Instagram users – engagement is high on Wednesday between 5 to 6 PM, while more people post on Thursdays Regardless, a majority of Instagram users log in when they have the extra time, such first thing in the morning, on their way home from work or school, or on Sundays. 3. Use Popular & Relevant Hashtags Search Google to find popular hashtags, which are used to organize photos. You can then use the relevant trending hashtags to you or your industry to gain more visibility for your photos, which should generate more interaction. For example, the top 10 hashtags are: #love, #instagood, #me; #like, #follow, #cute, #photooftheday, #tbt, #followme, and #tagsforlikes. While hashtags are an important asset when attracting new followers, you don’t want to go overboard. Instead of posting an entire paragraph of hashtags, try to select one to three hashtags per photo. Any more than three will seem spammy.  4. Follow Others If you want to follow others, then you’re going to have to follow them. This is a simple rule of reciprocation that is common on all social media formats. So, instead of just uploading photos and expecting people to come to you, you also have to put yourself out there. In other words, you have to be active. Search for users and brands that share your interests and comment, then like and share their photos. Follow Instagram stars and influencers and engage with them, or even ask for a shout-out. You could even look for tags containing tags like: #shoutout, #TagsForLikes, #ilovemyfollowers, and #follow.  5. Completely Fill Out Your Bio Your bio should be used to feature a call-to-action, branded hashtags, and links, which is a big deal in the quest for new Instagram users. It’s this section where users will discover who you or your brand are and whether or not they will follow you. Don’t, however, plead, sound desperate or come across as spammy. For example, do not include “Follow People Who Follow Me!” in your bio. You want to let users know who you are and why they should follow you. 6. Ask Questions in Photo Captions A simple and effective way to receive more likes on your photos is to simply ask a question in the photo’s caption. Not only will this increase your amount of likes, but it can also increase comments. And, as we’ve mentioned numerous times already, engagement is the best way to increase the amount of followers on Instagram. 7. Remember Why You Are on Instagram Before you get carried away and start posting all sorts of content onto Instagram, take a step back and remember why you joined in the first place. Why do you need more followers? Do you want to boost your ego? Are you looking to gain more exposure and feedback for your photography? Do you want to use Instagram as a promotional tool for your business? Understanding why you joined Instagram can help you attract new followers because you’ll know the audience you want to target. This means you’ll be searching and interacting with people in your niche, as opposed to casting too wide of a net. Another solid tactic is creating a call to action. By having a clear CTA, such as “Double-Tab to Like! ” people are more likely to engage with your posts since they’ll be aware of what you want from them. Again, when you have more engagement, you get more exposure, which in turn, gives you the opportunity to get more Instagram followers.  8. Post Frequently, But Not Too Much Once you attract new followers, how can you keep their interest? One of the easiest ways is to post relevant and attractive photos on a consistent basis; usually a few photos per day is just fine. If you have hundreds of images to share, spread them throughout several days. If you flood followers’ feeds you will not only have people unfollow you, your account won’t be as attractive to new followers. 9. Use Filters & Apps Do you remember what made Instagram so unique and popular in the first place? Filters. It gave people a chance to personalize their images. And, the more original and captivating your photos are, the more likely people are to share and follow your account. Since Instagram has 20 filters included in its app, there’s really no excuse for your photos to be filter-free. On top of filters, you can also make the most out of the various photo-editing apps to touch-up your photos before sharing on Instagram.

Image source Hey-hey! Growing Instagram is probably the most discussed topic today! And I’m sure everyone here wants to get more followers, right? But what do you exactly do to get started? Below I added some tips to get more popular on Instagram with spending no money. The first thing you should start if you want to move your Insta account to the top is to forget about all online services that sell likes and followers. Instagram has completely changed its algorithm for 2019, so any fake activity will not help you to become more visible.Actually, I think it's great news! Because now you have even more chances to promote your Instagram account for free and become recognized in your niche. So, the second step to getting more followers on Instagram is to identify your target audience. You should be confident in who your followers are and what they like to see in their feed. The third step you should do is to turn your account into a business one and connect it to your Facebook business page. It’s pretty simple to do. Follow this guide to get an Instagram Business account: Create a Facebook business (not your personal) page.Go to the setting of your Instagram account and choose Accounts → Switch to Business Account.Connect your Instagram Business Account to your Facebook Business Page. Here’s a great guide to this step: How do I link my Instagram account to a Facebook Page that I manage?The fourth thing to become visible in Instagram is adding the right profile information. Your name and profile bio must contain relevant keywords.  If you’re a local business, adding your location in your Insta Bio will simplify the way to find you for your customers and increase trust. Also, you’re allowed to add a link to your website, YouTube channel or another social network to your Instagram profile. Step five is all about your content. Here are the most important points: Be consistent (post every day). At least at the beginning you Insta journey.Post only high-quality content! Everything you add to your grid must be eye-catching, bright, intriguing and exciting.Provide value. Want people to listen to you and trust you? Be an expert.Tell a story. People prefer true stories more than advertising.Use the right CTAs. Interact with your audience. Don’t be afraid of asking questions.Using the right #HASHTAGS is the sixth step on the way to your popular Instagram account. The main rule: Don’t use the same hashtags for all your posts! If you use the same set of hashtags every time, most likely Instagram will consider your content as spam and decrease your reach. All you need is create about 7–10 sets of relevant hashtags and alternate them. It’s also important to find hashtags relevant to your niche. I don’t recommend that you use hashtags with 1 million and more followers. Add less frequently used but suitable hashtags and try to get on TOP for them. The next seventh tip to follow to get popular on Instagram is adding Stories! Add photos and videos to your Stories every day with mandatory location and relevant hashtags. Stories are the easiest way to expand your reach for a new audience. Stories, also great to interact with your audience with such features like Questions, Quiz, Countdown. The eight advice for getting more Instagram visitors is using live streaming and IGTV features. Instagram continues to promote these features and they give their users more impressions and reach. Constantly Like, Comment, Follow! It's a ninth tip. Use these actions for both your competitors and their followers. Yes, it’s important that you interact with competitors in your niche too. You need to do this to be shown among the suggested accounts of your competitor.  The last but not least tip is to monitor your account statistics every day. For this, go to Insights and find out what time your followers are the most active, which of your content are most engaged and saved, where in the world is the biggest concentration of your followers. Good luck! :)

There are several ways to get more followers on instagram. The idea of Instagram is to connect with people and for other people to connect with you. So i'll give a few quick tips here. 1. Follow people/accounts who are interested in what you are interested in: note that popular accounts have so many people following them that they might not follow you back. However, accounts with fewer followers are most likely to follow back. Use Discover to search for hashtags that you are interested in. eg if you are interested in music, type in #music or the genre you want and you can find posts on them.  2. Be consistent with your posts. I have found that people like accounts that are active or else they unfollow. So decide if you want to post daily or hourly. Whatever works for you. Some people say you should post your best images but frankly, even though that's a good thing, i have found that it doesn't matter so much as long as the image is relevant.Also, post pictures of you doing stuff! Reading, playing, dancing, hanging out with friends or family. People love that stuff. 4. Use (relevant/popular) hashtags. Very important. Seeing their experiences in pictures and being a part of it. You want your followers to be highly engaging. Not silent. That's why it's important that you grow your followers the right way. Here are my 7 tips to build a large and engaged audience on Instagram 1 - Never, ever buy likes or folowers from websites or use free apps. I know a lot of people on here are saying to do it, but trust me it’s not a good method. These followers and likes are almost always junk and are never engaging. It’s better to have an Instagram account that has 100 loyal followers that actually like and comment on your posts, than to have an account with 10,000 followers that never engage with your content. It’s always so sad to see accounts with thousands of followers and only get 50 likes at most. This is a clear sign that you have junk followers and it will be almost impossible to monetize your account. 2 - Post Frequently and on a Schedule Instagram is constantly changing their algorithm for how they show pictures on news feeds. It is important to understand that the less engaging your posts are the less Instagram will show your photos and videos. So we want to share throughout the day so people see our posts and start engaging with them. If we post a few times a week, chances are people won’t ever see your photos and eventually your account will be forgotten by them. 3 - Be Engaged Actually take the time to respond back to the people that leave comments on your photos. This shows that you are an involved profile and more people will want to start commenting, liking, and sharing your photos and videos. 4 - Share high quality and large photos Don’t share low quality photos. Make sure they aren’t blurry or pixelated. Also, start posting larger photos. Instagram now supports more than just their iconic square photos. We want our photos to pop and catch our followers attention. The larger they are the bigger the chances are that are followers will notice them and engage with them.  Here is a small account that I manage. Notice how the picture on the left takes up almost the entire screen and the one on the right is half the size. I posted the one on the left prior to realizing that larger images are working way better. Smaller images leave room for someone else’s photo to appear underneath or above it, which means less attention will be put on our photo. 5 - Stick to Your Niche Stay consistent with what you post. If you are a weight loss profile don’t post about basketball teams. If you are a travel account don’t post about cute puppies. Post relevant photos and videos. This also applies to hashtags. Do some research. Go to your top competitor’s accounts and see what hashtags they are using. We want to take advantage of Hastags. 5.1 - Hashtags Continued There is no true science to the amount of hashtags you should use, but they number I see most thrown around is eleven. Put at least 11 well related hashtags on your photos. And make sure to not put the hashtags in the description. This will definitely look spammy. Post the hashtags in a comment. As soon as you share the photo, comment on it by writing out the hashtags you chose. Don’t worry, the picture will still show up in the search results. 6 - Don’t Be Afraid to Collab Share other account’s photos, ask them to share yours. Instagram is a social network, so be social. A growing Instagram growth method is paying for shout outs. (I know I said not to pay for followers or likes, but this is different. Most of the followers and likes you pay for are from fake accounts used just to like and follow accounts and do nothing else) Buying shout outs is a great way to build your following because you are reaching out to accounts that are showing that they actually have an engaging audience that are interested in what they post. Now, this can be a costly method for growth, but it is definitely something to consider. I hope this helps.

Instagram changes its algorithm on a very regular basis and its impossible to determine what brings you the most followers. But there are certainly few things that can help you increase your followers organically. Curated below are the some of the tips that really helped us blow our accounts. Niche Instagram knows what your account is about and who would be interested in your content. If you like a lot of dog videos and post a lot of content about dogs, it sure knows that you would be interested in dog videos and your content would be good for other folks who are interested in dogs. If its possible to pick a specific niche, go for it.Videos vs Image posts If your moto is to gain followers, post video content over image content any day. Currently Instagram suggests your content to other users who might be interested in your content. If any of your video goes viral then you will gain massive followers overnightRegular Posts Some say to not post too much content, but for us posting too much content is what gained us a lot of followers. Try posting during different times of the day and different frequency and see what really works for your accountFollow Unfollow Ethically it might be a wrong thing to do, but for your account to be visible it is really necessary that you have some amount of initial followers (around 2000) for instagram to start suggesting your videos to others. Do not go following anyone or everyone, make sure that you are following people in your own niche. Best to follow people who comment on others postsWe are currently managing 30+ accounts with a total of around 300K+ followers. Our strategy is very simple, we repost content of other users every 1 hour. To help us with the process we built an automation software that reposts content that we like every one hour.

To avoid getting banned by Instagram, you should know the Instagram’s rules and restrictions to seem normal and not a bot. You shouldn’t take too many actions in short time because Instagram may recognize you as a spam and it would ban your account if you keep doing a lot. First of all you should know that the limitations are not the same for all Instagram users and depends on different factors such as: The age of your Instagram accountThe number of your followersYour account’s engagementYour account’s activity Follow/ unfollow Following and unfollowing is count as the same actions. The daily limit is 200 a day. 10 follows and unfollows per hour would keep your account safe and saves your account from being suspended. Also, there is no limit on how many people can follow you. Remember to start slow and then gradually increase the number of following and unfollowing week by week. Make sure that you are not spamming Instagram. Likes The maximum number is 1000 a day. But it is not the same for all Instagram users. In order to keep your account safe and not locked out, you should be satisfied with less than 700 likes per day. Comments It is about 180 to 200 per day. Don’t post the same comment over and over. Instagram recognizes duplicate comments, and it would punish your account for what you did. And don’t leave emojis without text as a comment, they look like spam. Direct messages About 50 to 80 new conversations per day are the safe zone. Note: If you are a new Instagram user, your total action limit is 500 a day. This includes Like, Comment, Follow, unfollow. Also, you can send 20 to 50 direct messages a day. Hashtag Choosing the right hashtag would capture people’s attention, and you’ll get more Likes and Followers. But don’t overuse them. You should use up to 30 hashtags per post. IGTV As you know, Instagram rolled out IGTV about a year ago which lets you share the video. You can create videos for up to 10 minutes, but some users can post up to one hour long videos. Story The story limitation is for users who share too many stories. You can add up to 100 stories. Story highlight Fortunately, there is no limit for story highlights. Tag If you are interested in tagging people, you should know that the maximum number is 20. Mention You can mention up to 10 Instagram users per post.

You can choose if you want to go the organic route (not spending money) or you want to spend money on promos and ads. If you don’t want to (most people don’t) then below you can read some of my advice that work really great on getting those initial followers and starting to grow. First of all, you need to have good content and post consistently (at least once per day). You need to choose a niche, and try to niche it down a bit especially in the beginning of your account (what I mean by it is you don’t want to make general account where you posts selfies or your content is all over the place cars, travel, memes, motivational quotes, fitness, etc) you want to choose one niche like for example travel and than niche it down some more for example showcasing just beaches or mountains or Arial pictures, etc. It will be much easier to grow if you niche it down like that. Make nice profile picture, if your username doesn’t look clean, short and kinda memorable, try to come up with a new username that does, write down good BIO explaining what your followers can expect and mention your niche if we use example of a niche from above you can do something like: “Showcasing best beaches all around the world Every traveller loves gorgeous beaches” add some emojis as well (it’s easier to grab people’s attention with emojis ) as you can see I’ve mentioned two keywords beaches and travel.You also want to have good caption structure and do some hashtag research and write down several sets of hashtags (I usually use 25–30 hashtags, 30 is the limit set by Instagram btw).Post stories as well it helps engage with your audience and you get nice circle around your profile pic which makes your profile stand out moreNow the thing with Instagram is, you need to get the initial following in order to start ranking for hashtags and to grow organically. The best method that works right now to get those initial 1–2.5k followers (depending on your niche and quality of your content) is follow-unfollow method, you basically find a page in your niche that’s bigger than yours and start following people who liked their recent photo, people get notification that you’ve followed them, check your account and follow you back if they like what they see. You need to do this manually, especially since recent updates, don’t try any bots and tools, that’s the reason why most people fail with this method.If you have time you should also post meaningful comments on other peoples photos (especially those you are following) because it will help you gain more followers and also get you more follow-backs from the previous method.If you did everything right and post consistantly once you get initial 1–2.5k followers your account will start to grow on its own organically just from posting consistently. When this happens and you start ranking for hashtags, it’s usually a good idea to increase the posting frequency because it will help you grow even faster.Once you hit 5k followers you can start contacting other similar pages in your niche to exchange shoutouts and collab which will help you get more exposure and accelerate your growth.Once you hit 10k followers, you get the swipe up option in stories (linking out) and you can start monetizing your account.Depending on how you execute this, you can grow pretty fast and completely free. We are living in digital era. Its one of the easiest era to build your business online without spending any dime, and grow to millions of followers. BUT, it takes efforts, consistency, uniqueness to be in the top. Growing thousands of followers for many different accounts, i have figured out some of the best ways that helps me grow Instagram followers in a fast and a organic way. Using these ways you can grow your account even if you have less than 100 followers to hundred thousands of followers within months. Below i am listing some of the ways using which you grow your followers, these tips not only helps you grow your followers but also to improve your profile engagement, brand awareness and have a good social presence. Content is the KING : Original Content : This is one of the most important reason for success of any big page on IG, Make sure you are posting original content, no one wants to see repeated content on all pages.Provide FREE value as much as you can : Remember, you can only grow if you are providing free value to the audience,audience will only follow you if they are getting real value which can make them smarter, happier, improve their life, get to know something new, learn something that may helps them in improving their career, earnings, better fashion tips, dress smartly, look confident etc.Relatable Content : One of the popular ways why many accounts attracts lots of audience is because they post content that the users can connect with, they feel emotional connect, similar thinking. So, try to put content that is easy to understand and people easily connected with it.Profile Optimization : Profile Picture : The first thing that any user sees whenever someone founds your content useful/interesting/entertaining is they look towards your profile picture, make sure to have a profile picture which depicts your brand, easily to read in small thumbnails if it has a text or a logo.Username : Try to keep it similar to your brand/name/business . Don’t use too long usernames, keep it short and crisp. Try to avoid period or underscore in username.Bio : Bio plays an important role for every new visitor to page to whether scroll down to your page to see your content or not. Bio in points works best. First two lines of Bio are very important, you should mention what is your page is about, what type of content users will get to see in that page. Then after two lines, you can provide some additional information or Call to action, to follow your page or visit your link.Highlights : If you post stories, then you can categorize them in different highlights providing the best stories that you posted.MOST IMPORTANT TIPS : HASHTAGS : Hashtags are the most important factor for any account to get their posts reach to millions of users without spending any content. I see most of the users spend hours to create content, writing captions but hardly takes 5 minutes to choose their hashtags. You have to spend time to select them. Make sure that you are choosing hashtags related to your niche only. Don’t change your hashtags in every posts, best way is to use 11–20 Hashtags, using same hashtags again and using 30 every time can make your account shadowbanned, don’t select hashtags which have too much volume, try to use hashtags within 1 million posts, unless you have more than 10k followers, also don’t use which have too low volumes. When you found hashtags which does good for you, make 3–4 sets of them and use them randomly on posts. The rules for hashtags don’t work same on accounts, you have to figure it out what method works best for you.Users Engagement : There is no use of having thousands of followers, if your engagement rate is low. Its one of the underrated thing which most people ignore. Having a good followers engagement in your page, can really help you boost your post, have better growth and Brand Awareness. Try to interact with your followers as much you can. Reply every comment in your posts, ask them questions, Ask about their opinions, tell them to tag their friends that can be benefited from your post. Use stickers in Stories. Ask your followers to follow on Post notifications.Call To Action : Many of my clients complained that get despite getting thousand of likes, they are getting very less amount of followers or link visits or sales, this is because they don’t add any Call to action in their posts or they try to use it in inappropriate way that makes them looks spammy. So, what i recommends is have a proper post caption, firstly mentions the what the post is all about or starts with asking a question, then proving value to the audience, details about the posts, minimum 2–3 lines. After that just simply ask them to give a follow if they want to see more of your valuable content, visit your bio link to know about you etc. REMEMBER, adding call to action is necessary to get better results, because, most of the people will just simply like your content and scroll down.Consistency : Many people complained even after following all the ways told my be they did not see any growth or get good results. When i visit their profiles, i saw that they did not have any consistency in their account. Sometimes they post in weeks, sometimes more than 5 posts in a day. This is what making your profile not ranking good. Instagram runs on smart algorithms that their developers spends years too develop and continue making changes everyday. So, the algorithms are developed in such a way that if the found users to be consistent on the platform, posting at proper timings, engaging with users, don’t spam the platform, gets good results in the posts then the account automatically gets good rank in hashtags and on explore page.So, these are some of the most smartest ways to grow on Instagram at a good rate and get good amount of organic followers. First of all, mind the follower contract. People see your existing posts as a promise on what to expect from you in the future. If you’ve posted 500 irresistible pictures of cats, and the person evaluating your profile just can’t get enough irresistible cats in their feed, you’ll be more likely to gain a new follower. This means that you must think about what your existing board is promising to new potential followers. (And when they start following you, you can’t expect their continuous engagement if you radically or often decide to change the direction of your posts.) Now, some might say that “all posts are about me and my life”. And that’s fine if your life is interesting enough to attract new followers besides friends, family, and co-workers. Because “keeping all your ducks in a row” might not be enough to compel a profile visitor to follow you. Now, some Instagram users have a huge following despite not focusing on a clear and concise niche. Celebrities are common in this category. If you want to use their Instagram strategy, then it’s less about Instagram as a platform and more about figuring out a way to become famous. Others take the route of buying their followers. And buying likes on their pictures. Even buying comments from bots. But what’s the point in posting pictures for a bunch of machines? And if you’re only trying to impress your friends, don’t bother. If you bought your followers, they’ll figure it out. If not, maybe look into getting smarter friends? If your follower contract is tight, then it might be time to examine your hashtag strategy: First, look at how many likes and comments you get on average. Then, research hashtags that are relevant to your picture strategy and find tags where you can reasonably expect to have your picture visible on the tag page as one of nine top posts. For instance, if you have 50 likes on average, only use relevant hashtags where you only need 40 likes to be featured as a top post for that particular tag. If you use 30 carefully chosen hashtags and you get featured as one of nine top posts on all of them, you’ll have a better chance of being discovered by people who are looking for interesting accounts to follow. If you’ve taken a picture of a sunset and you get 100 likes on average, don’t use the hashtag #sunset because you won’t stand a chance on being featured on such a generic and common tag. As your average number of comments and likes grows, replace your hashtags for “better” ones continuously. Think of it as climbing a ladder of engagement. Now, as your gaining traction, it’s not a bad idea to improve your content quality. If you don’t get into this habit, you’ll sooner or later hit your threshold. Despite doing everything “right” you might struggle to grow simply because your content isn’t good enough. Next, turn your gaze towards the engagement economy. Lots of people will only follow you if you follow them back. Lots of people will only like your pictures if you, at least once in a while, like one of their pictures. The same goes for comments. Make no mistake about it: There are bots for auto-follows, auto-unfollows, auto-liking, and auto-commenting. But if you’re looking to build true engagement, your engagement must be true as well. When you reach critical mass you won’t be able to keep up and that’s okay, but until then — engage with the community using the hashtags you’re targeting. There you have it. Simple, yes. Lots of work? Yes, that too.

This is my experience growing a page in the business niche called NowFuture to over 500k followers: First, optimize your profile so people will hit the follow button when they see your page. Otherwise the rest of the strategies are useless. Is the bio good? Are the last ~15 posts awesome? Is the logo good? Do they know what your page is when they land on it? Etc, etc…Post daily or as often as you can (this depends what kind of account you have, it will be hard for a personal page). The more you post = more chances to be found. IG also favours active accounts in the algorithmGo to similar accounts to yours and repost their most viral content or best performing posts. If it went viral for them it’s likely to go viral for youConstantly test hashtags. I use 20–25 hashtags per post and have 5+ sets that I rotate through. So in total I have at least 100 hashtags that I switch around and testLeave genuine comments on recent and related posts in your niche. This is very time consuming but everything helps if you’re starting from 0Buy shoutouts. This is the fastest way to grow but obviously costs moneyIf you’re over 2k followers do S4S with other accounts. I did 3 shout for shouts per day to get my first 100k followersFind engagement groups that leave genuine commentsMake your page better and truly unique from everyone elseCreate original content with your own logo on it. If it’s good, other accounts will repost it and you get free shoutoutsConsistency, consistency, consistency. I stopped posting for a few months and lost all my momentum, even started losing followers. Keep this in mindAt my peak, I was getting 30,000 followers per month using these strategies. It takes a lot of work and consistency, especially now that IG is more competitive. Being different is more important than ever. Hope this helps!

In 2020, I grew an Instagram page from 0 to 100,000 Instagram followers in 6 months. This is my story of how I grew my Instagram page and how you can grow your Instagram page and achieve 100,000 followers in less than a year. Whether you're an Instagram novice or an Instagram expert, this guide and the accompanying video will help you get more Instagram followers. In the last few days of December, I set-up a page that originally was a hobby page to document my journey to financial freedom. However, over time Instagram became my answer to how I could achieve financial freedom. From hobby to side hustle to making a full-time income from Instagram, I was able to scale my Instagram page and grow my Instagram followers to the point where it produced me a full-time income. Here are some of the methods I used during various stages of my page's growth. 0-1000 Followers Going to hashtags related to my page, going to the recent tab and finding pages like mine with a similar number of followers. Then, I would like and comment on their posts, follow them and DM them so I could build real long term relationships with similar new accounts to me.Creating carousel posts rather than "viral posts". The first page would serve as a title page to force people to actually swipe all the way through my content. I'd end them with a slide that was a follow call to action.1000-10,000 Followers I used a special kind of shoutout called a target shoutout which I explain in more depth within the video.Doing shoutout for shoutouts with similar sized pages once a day on the feed (and maybe 2-3 on my story).I'd still post these more in-depth carousel posts to help differentiate myself.10,000-100,000 Followers I used a $5/day FB ads method to help me grow, these followers tended to follow less pages like mine than followers gained from shoutouts so the engagement rate was a little higher.Then I moved to target shoutouts and targeted pages with a high US audience to help make my page more monetizable and it was cheaper to target the USA this way, than with FB ads.I hope this helps anyone looking to grow their page on Instagram. Don't forget to check out the video that goes into how I grew to 100,000 Instagram followers in just 6 months in far more depth.

Step 1: Making our Instagam Account We knew that the experiment would have to have a good Instagram attached. We followed our own advice for setting up a good Instagram accounts and made the Not Your Girl Instagram, scheduling pictures that hit on the aesthetic we were going for. Not Your Girl is curated to appeal to edgy, fashion-focused millennials.  All the images are high quality, and we posted regularly, but not excessively—about once per day. The Instagram is linked to an online shop where you can buy some branded Not Your Girl gear and a few other items. We also used a bunch of hashtags on each post, to help the organic aspect of our growth. We used the same hashtags throughout the entire experiment, to keep everything but our follower-gaining tactics consistent. Step 2: Gaining Instagram Followers – The Real Way Outside of using hashtags to tap into our potential audience, we followed pretty much Best practices for gaining followers the usual way. We looked at accounts that had a similar aesthetic to Not Your Girl, and went into their followers. We then followed some of their followers and liked some of their posts.  Those users then saw that we had engaged with them, and hopefully followed us back. We didn’t go in and comment on posts or DM any of the people we followed, because we wouldn’t have been able to keep that consistent with our bot. Step 3: Gaining Instagram Followers – The Bot Way We temporarily stopped gathering new followers and posting before we switched over to buying followers. This gave us a nice clean break when we went back to look at our results — there is no overlap at all between our bot results and our human results.  There are a lot of bots and services out there you can use to buy followers on Instagram. These types of services are abundant, and often seem pretty fake. We used Boost Socials which claims to help you fully automate your account and give you “real followers, likes, and comments.”

There are several rules you must observe to get more followers on Instagram. A. One is using hashtags. A lot of people take hashtags for granted and and look over using them. You’d better use all 30 hashtags on each post so you will be visited and reached for more key phrases in search of Instagram. B. Another thing you must consider is scheduling your posts. You must post regularly and on a hourly/daily/weekly… basis. so that Instagram has a clue of when to crawl into your profile and bring your new contents out to be visible to the Explore. Plus, your audience know exactly when to await your contents. C. Add value to your followers. Only when a content is valuable people want to follow you to get more of that kind. By “valuable” I mean anything that your audience is interested in. Some people might be interested in astrology, so if your Instagram account is adding value in this field to them, then they will follow you. Some people look for added value in reading “yellow pages”. So there is no difference. All you need to do is to find your niche, know your audience and give them what they want. D. You can automate your Instagram. Sometimes life gets too busy and you won’t have time to spend time “virtually”. Then an Instagram automation too (aka Instagram bot) might do you good. But look out for scam bots which might get your account banned. Study and research well before you choose one. A good and trusted automation tool must safe your account by observing all Instagram limitation and rules. E. Post stories and go live. This is what your followers will love most. People like to be invited to you most intimate and private moments and they will identify with you are a photographer, post a story or go on a live about the behind the scene of of your most popular works. #1. Join Instagram Engagement Groups Are you just starting to learn how to get followers on Instagram? This tactic is best for beginners. Some Instagram newbies have seen their Instagram followers increase fast. What did they do differently? They joined engagement groups. engagement groups to gain followers on Instagram While it can be tempting to join the biggest Instagram engagement groups, truth is you’ll get a more targeted list of Instagram followers by sticking to your niche. You can find engagement groups for travel, beauty, fashion and more. In these groups, you can get followers and likes from people who have shared interests. But if you’re serious about getting the attention, you should also return the favor by following fan pages for people who join the group. I’ve had friends get 2,000 new followers in only a couple weeks using this strategy. While it might not help with immediate sales, it helps you gain credibility early on so your Instagram page doesn’t show that you only have 38 followers. This is more of a short-term strategy for your first few weeks on Instagram not a long-term one for getting Instagram followers. #2. Repost Others’ Content When I was building my store’s Instagram account, my entire posting strategy revolved around reposting other people’s content. The only way to do this without getting flagged is to credit the original poster in your description, every time. Instagram has now updated their policy and you’re required to ask for permission before reposting. When I first started, I’d take screenshots and add the pictures to my Instagram. What really helped my page take off was the Repost app. It allowed me to start reposting video content on Instagram. One of the biggest home runs I had was when I re-posted a video that amassed 52,862 views, got 1264 comments and 9,147 likes. At the time, I didn’t even have 10,000 followers so this was a big freaking deal. how to get followers on instagram with reposting Why’d I repost other people’s content instead of posting my own? Because I knew that it was easier to repost content. Plus, my visual and video content would never be as good as someone else’s. Hey, at least I’m honest about it! How did I know what to repost? I’d look at the numbers. I was pretty active on Instagram so I’d browse the list of hashtags I came up with and used daily to find the top performing posts that weren’t posted by other fan pages (so not my competitors) but by individual people. I’d then watch the videos and look at the pictures to see which ones I had the biggest reactions to. If I felt the urge to share someone else’s post, I knew I had to repost it onto my page. So if you’re just learning how to get followers on Instagram, this high-impact strategy is simple enough for a beginner. (You can use Instaberry to help you do this automatically) #3. Ask Customers to Share their Photos When you’re just starting out, getting followers on Instagram will be a lot easier with customer photos in your feed. Why? It can help increase social proof. more followers on instagram If you’ve never had a customer before, reach out to influencers in your niche with under 5,000 followers. I know the number seems low but influencers with few followers on Instagram want to monetize their accounts and will be willing to take pictures with your products at a much lower rate. You can also offer them an affiliate deal where they’ll get a commission for every sale they score with their customer referral link. If you’ve already had a couple of sales, reach out to customers and offer a free gift or cash incentive for taking quality images with the product they purchased. Offering incentives isn’t going to be your long-term strategy but for the short-term while you try to build your brand, this can help you grow. As more customers start seeing customer photos on your Instagram, they’ll naturally start tagging you in posts when they receive their products. If you comment on their post, repost the content and follow them you’ll likely get them to follow back. Though some will follow you after tagging you in their post on their own. #4. Have a consistent style that hooks people in I know this sounds like one of those ‘blah, blah, blah’ ways to gain followers on Instagram. But it isn’t. Here’s why: people don’t follow you because of the content you’ve posted but because of what they think the future content you’ll post will be like. Say you have a corgi fan page, every day you post cute corgi pictures and videos without fail. If Instagram users keep seeing your posts eventually they’ll realize that you always post the cutest corgi content. So they follow you with the expectation that your account will always be more of the same type of content. Having a consistent style or theme is more than just a branding play, it’s about creating an expectation for your Instagram account that your followers or potential followers can count on. They want to see more of the same type of content, every day. If you can deliver that consistency with every post, you’ll grow your followers on Instagram at a faster rate over time. #5. Ignore the Hashtag Rules Many experts will tell you to only use 5 or 11 hashtags or some other arbitrary numbers. But when I was building my store’s Instagram account, I ignored their advice and ran wild with it. I’d copy and paste a list of hashtags from my phone onto my app. Then, I’d sometimes switch it up to try different hashtags but eventually, I knew which ones usually worked best. Usually, I’d go as close to or right to the max number of hashtags possible. 30. That’s the magic number. Truth is, you add all those hashtags in the first comment. And as your page engagement grows, no one will ever see the first comment because they’re too busy tagging their friend in your post. Sure, when you’re starting out people might see it. But if the goal is to increase visibility, the easiest way to do it is to add more hashtags. As you gain followers, your posts will rank higher for those hashtag keywords giving you even more visibility. If your hashtags are niche specific, you’ll increase your likelihood of being found by a relevant audience which will help you grow your followers on Instagram as well. So avoid generic hashtags like #love or #picoftheday if you’re selling fashion, for example.

First the most important: post quality pictures, this is the base for everything. If your content isn’t good enough, you won’t get those likes which are needed for reach and followers. Be consistent with your feed and activity. Create a cohesive feed, Instagram is a highly visual place. Post regularly but find a pace that works for you. Don’t try to post more often if your content quality suffers. Create good captions, make people want to comment your posts. You also need comments for reach and followers. Be active: like and comment other accounts you like yourself. DON’T follow others in hopes of getting them to follow you back. Most of them won’t follow you back and you’ll end up following many unneccesary accounts and this will backfire in the future. Follow the ones you truly like and concentrate on engaging with them. Follow/unfollow is the ultimate worst option. Ask for story exchange from accounts similar to yours. Ask if they’d like to share your account in their stories and then you’ll share them too. Most of the people are open for story exchange. This will give you some extra exposure easily. Then you only need to be patient. Growth doesn’t come fast in the beginning and the real fast growth starts after 3–5k if your account is optimised for growth. You get fast results with inorganic tactics but in long term these tactics will make it hard or even impossible to grow organically later. When you go all organic it’s possible to gain 100–500 followers per day constantly.

First of all be smart in picking the ways to gain more followers on Instagram. Post consistently According to Tailwind, a profile that posted 7 or more times a week will get more likes and followers faster than a profile that post less frequently. With Instagram’s algorithmic timeline, consistency is the key to get your post seen by many audience and appear on top of the feeds. You daily audiences might end up be your new followers. Cross-promote your dedicated hashtag Use dedicated hashtags when it comes to Instagram caption ideas. Be more creative in that parts as it plays a huge role in gaining attention of the audiences. It might be a starting point to spark an interest to your daily audiences. Choose hashtag that seem to be optimal in number of getting maximum engagements and exposure. Participate in massively popular conversations Instagram is very much a community, and one great way to get involved in that community is by engaging with them in conversations. Engage with people and brands that might be interested in your content on regular basis. It will then turns them from a usual audiences of your Instagram to a loyal follower. Besides that, proactively respond to as many comments as possible to start a discussion on your post. Run Instagram contest It’s another great way to expand your reach while increasing engagement on your photo. Run a contest and then ask people to follow your account and Like or comment on the photo in order to enter the contest. You can try add a UGC (User-Generated Content) element to the contest whereby they need to post a photo of their own and use a specific hashtag along with following your account. Here are an example of Starbucks promoting a UGC contest on their Instagram account.  Connect with a reliable agency Through this way you will get real people who use Instagram daily to be as your followers. This will boost your popularity. Thus, get partner with a reliable agency to do all marketing side on behalf. They will help spread the words and gain more real followers. Your popularity on Instagram will boost and lead to increase in organic followers. Hope this helps!

I don’t think anyone with any social media knowledge would say that you can increase your following (without buying followers) without having good, high-quality content. This means staying on topic (so if your account is about food or sports, don’t share an outfit of the day post or pictures from your birthday party. Additionally, while instagram began as a place to share your iphone photos after sprucing them up with filters, the vast majority of accounts with large followings are sharing images that are professionally taken with DSLR cameras and edited in photoshop or lightroom. People are beginning to expect magazine-quality images that are eye catching, well-lit, and have good composition. Take an objective look at your grid, and ask yourself - “Would I follow me?” If the answer is no, take some time to figure out why, and delete any images from your feed or highlights that don’t meet your standards. Another way to encourage people to follow you is engagement. It is, after all, called SOCIAL media. Make sure you’re replying to all comments. Ask questions in your captions to encourage others to comment. Make it a dialogue more often than simply putting out content. This works in your favor for multiple reasons, as you can get information about what content people like, use it for research if you’re offering products or services, and get yourself featured on the “explore” page if you have enough engagement quickly enough for the instagram algorithm to feature you. That last benefit is why many people start or join instagram engagement pods, which are groups of people who support each other by liking and commenting on each other’s content in hopes of getting featured on the explore page. Some say that engaging in all of Instagram’s features make it more likely to have your content shown on the explore page. So if you’re not already using stories, IGTV, and instagram live, I’d recommend you do so! Other ways to get people to discover you are to make sure that you are tagging the locations of your posts, both in stories and in your grid. This way, other people looking at those locations can find your post, and if they like what they see, they may follow you. You can also use hashtags to help other people discover you. You can use up to 30 hashtags at a time. I would use a mix of relatively popular hashtags and more niche-focused. My strategy is to use the same set of hashtags for about half of my 30 on every post, and then to add some that are specific to that picture topic and/or caption. Hashtags work in the grid, but they can also help people discover you in instagram stories, so use them there, too! You can even shrink the hashtags down and hide them so it doesn’t clutter your story image. A great way to start bringing people to your page is to go to theirs and start a conversation. There are some bots that will do this for you, however I caution you to avoid that, as I’ve seen auto-comments be wildly inappropriate and offensive at times. For example, I’ve seen tribute posts to a family member passing away where a bot comments “Awesome shot!” - yikes! So cringey! It’s much better to take the time to go to the accounts of potential fans (for example, the people commenting on larger accounts in your niche, or your competitor’s accounts), and liking a few of their pictures and leaving a genuine comment on a post or two of theirs! Another way to get more attention to your account is to ask your current following to tag people on your posts. For example, “Tag a friend who would think this is funny” or “tag someone who has been a great friend to you” etc. You can also sweeten the pot by doing a giveaway related to your account’s topic, requiring people to follow you to enter, with bonus entries for tagging friends, reposting your content, or sharing it to their stories. This, however, is not always the best strategy because sometimes people follow just until the giveaway ends and unfollow, or even go as far as making accounts solely for giveaways. Some people follow tons of people at a time, wait a few days, and unfollow (whether the person follows back or not). I don’t recommend this, because I think on the receiving end, it is annoying. Many people frown upon it and I’ve seen people complain about it. It may work, but I don’t consider it a best practice personally. Overall, nothing beats having high-quality content and relationship-building, but a good hashtag strategy and outreach go a long way to boost a following as well! I hope that helps!

More powerful tips to get instagram followers instant : Here are some effective tips get more instagram engagement  Post consistently (at least once a day):- Visual marketing tool Tailwind studied more than 100,000 Instagram profiles in 2017 to understand how posting frequency affects follower growth and engagement rate. They found that the more often you post, the more likes and followers you get. According to the study, profiles that posted seven or more times a week (or at least once a day) get more likes and gain more followers faster than those that post less frequently. Try live videos, and Stories:- While Instagram started as a photo-sharing network, it has grown beyond just photos. With features like videos, live videos, and Stories, brands can now create many different types of content to engage their fans and grow their following. Here are a few compelling reasons to try posting these new content types: The average engagement for videos is growing faster than the average engagement for images3 Get creative with hashtagging:- When it comes to Instagram caption ideas, you need to look beyond the one-word, obvious hashtags. Sure, you want to use those, too, but mix it up and use hashtags to tell part of your story. Be funny, ironic, or outrageous--just don't be BORING. Collaborative workspace company WeWork is great at this, and they include a fun mix of Instagram content. * .Write an Engaging Bio: While posts are likely the first thing potential followers will see, your profile helps provide valuable information about your brand or connect with your audience. There are a few options you can go with, like Away’s simple “Thoughtful standards for modern travel” tagline. Or, you might include a more casual bio, Post at your best times:- After looking at more than five studies on the best times to post, I learned that there isn’t a universal best time to post on Instagram. Instead, every brand has its own best times to post. You have yours, too! Timeliness of a post is one of the major factors in the Instagram Insights Followers Alternatively, you can use Instagram analytics tools like Iconosquare or Buffer for Business to find your best time to post using your Instagram data.
