Seven things to have in mind when growing followers on Instagram: 1. Put an accent to the attractiveness of your posts. Put yourself in a position of a typical IG user; you’ll stop scrolling only when you see an image or a video that looks interesting enough. Regardless of the type of the content you post, you have to make sure that your posts intrigue your audience. So, focus on the quality of your content, because that’s how Instagram works. 2. Instagram’s algorithm favors the accounts that are active, i.e. that post often enough. In order to receive more followers and get more engagement, you should post every day if possible (but not too much, since some people will become annoyed if they see tons of posts by the same profile every time they log in to IG). 3-4 posts daily should do the work. 3. Some of the most popular (and the most profitable) topics or niches are: fitness, health, dating & relationships, self-improvement, pets, how to make money online, etc. If you fall into the some of the mentioned categories, chances are that you will gain more followers. 4. Look for the profiles (who post similar stuff as you) that have the most engagement (likes & comments) and the most followers, and see which hashtags they use. Now use those hashtags in your posts. Also, don’t forget that the hashtags shouldn’t be too general, but more specific. If you use very popular hashtags you won’t be noticed, since thousands (or millions) of people are posting using the same ones. 5. Engage with the posts from other profiles you see on Instagram’s explore page, regardless of whether they follow you or not. Like & comment on them. This also improves your visibility, and increases the chances for you to get noticed. 6. If you have a blog, a Facebook page, or a business website, put the link to your Instagram profile in all those places to increase traffic to your profile. 7. There are many online platforms that actually sell likes and comments, but the vast majority of them is useless since that kind of engagement is usually coming from fake accounts. If you could get numerous likes or comments from accounts that are real and active on Instagram, then you’re on the right path. Instead of purchasing fake likes and generic comments (which Instagram doesn’t like, so it can be harmful to your profile), the service called Fuelgram can provide you with a large number of real likes and comments coming from influential Instagram profiles. Since there you can also select an appropriate niche/topic (photography, lifestyle, travel, fashion), and buy likes coming from the accounts belonging to that particular niche, you will rapidly improve your post reach and engagement, which will get you more relevant followers organically.

1. Optimize your Instagram account Before you set out figuring out how to gain followers on Instagram, one of the most important steps is to have your account fully optimized. Think of your brand’s Instagram bio as the “homepage” to your account. 2. Keep a consistent content calendar The worst thing you can do when trying to get followers on Instagram is to post content at random, haphazard times. If you’re lucky enough to get users following you in the beginning, you don’t want to make them forget they followed you in the first place. 3. Schedule Instagram posts in advance While the Instagram algorithm has changed to show users more content they like, posting at the right times can still give your posts more visibility by increasing the overall engagement they receive. 4. Get partners and brand advocates to post your content When you’re learning how to get more Instagram followers, it’s important to know the value of your audience. The larger your follower count grows (organically), the more buyers and interested customers you will have. 5. Avoid fake Instagram followers There’s a huge difference between an Instagram account having fake and legitimate followers. It might seem tempting to simply purchase Instagram followers, but the backlash outweighs the perks of organic follower growth. 6. Showcase your Instagram everywhere How are people going to find an account unless you promote your Instagram? Make sure your Instagram account is listed with your website and other social networks. 7. Post content followers want While this is easier said than done, it’s smart to learn what content your followers want to see. You’ll quickly find on Instagram that some content performs better than others. This is why testing is so important. 8. Get the conversation started One of the best ways to make users aware of your Instagram is through conversation. According to the 2020 Sprout Social Index, consumers want to engage with visual-first content like photos (68%) and video (50%), followed by 30% who want to engage with text posts. Instagram is the perfect fit for this audience profile, pairing eye-catching visuals with captions that can be just as engaging when you perfect your Instagram caption copywriting skills. 9. Find hashtags that convert One of the most tried-and-true ways to get followers on Instagram is through hashtags. For years hashtags have served as an essential tool for discovery and allowed us to extend our social reach. As a marketer, you want to build your community by gaining followers and hashtags provide just that. 1o. Make your Instagram followers happy Last but not least, when you make your Instagram followers happy, you see the payoff in audience growth. We’ve given you plenty of tips for brainstorming and scheduling content, so put them into practice in a way that feels real to your brand voice. In other words, avoid seeming needy, sales-driven or robotic.

What I love about Instagram is the community you can find and create. If you want to get more Instagram followers, there are many ways to do it, but they are not all equal. Some people choose to buy followers. I do not recommend this. To outside people checking out your account for the first time, that can make it look like you’re getting a lot of traction on your posts. In reality, your individual photos won’t have a lot of engagement, nor will it be authentic and community-building. Start by following people who are interested in the same things as you (fashion, food, travel, etc.) and like and comment on their posts. Don’t spam them with emojis, but give positive feedback or encouragement. You can search for photos from a particular place, so find people who are posting from your city. I’ve met a few awesome people this way, and have then been followed by Instagrammers whom I admire and who have lots of great content (as well as a lot of followers). Spend time taking good-quality photos and use an editing app like A Color Story (my favorite) or VSCO cam. Make sure your photos are bright and sharp. Over time, keep a consistent theme on your feed. Your top 9 photos will be the first thing someone sees when they come to your page, and it will look a lot better if you have a color scheme or use the same editing techniques on each photo. Be genuine, share what you’re passionate about. It’s better to work on making your little corner of the internet fun and reflective of you than get a bunch of followers. Don’t get discouraged by slow growth. Make it for you. EDIT: P.S. hashtags are also a good way for people to find your photos. You can add a comment to a photo after you’ve posted it with hashtags that are relevant to your content. Use area specific hashtags (like #texasig) or community based hashtags (like #myunicornlife). Use hashtags that have less posts so there’s less competition, and don’t get too general (like #love).

This is an all-too-common question here on Quora and other places. While there may be different tricks you can do to boost your followers, if you truly want to boost your account, it takes more than tricks. The amount of followers, while impressive, doesn’t matter as much as your actual engagement. Of course, if you have 1,000,000 followers, it’s a high likelihood you’ll have a few thousand interactions. However, you’re better off with 10,000 followers and 9,000 engaged, than 1,000,000 and 10,000 engaged. If you have a smaller audience that is more engaged, it means you have a more loyal following. You are able to remain more personal and provide better service. Of course, let’s talk about how to increase followers and not by purchasing or cheating it. First you want solid content; consistent solid content. You want to make sure you’re improving up on the content as well. Let people come along the journey. Now, we move back to the engagement part. I know I’ve already covered engagement, if I haven’t said engagement enough, I’ll say it again, engagement. I’m sure by now, this may seem like a bit of work to some and they’ve already scrolled or moved on, but if you’re still here, you understand its importance. It’s building relationships, it is building a friendship/relationship with your audience. I’m not talking about BBQs with your audience, though that could be cool, or different outings, but talking to your audience and connecting is a key point in building up a relationship. These relationships lead to support and collaborative efforts. The other night I was able to do some behind-the-scene photography onset of some films. It was my relationship with one person, and it has lead to a relationship with others I can work with. As I continue to grow my relationship with the different people and the people they introduce me to, I’ll continue to be asked to do more work. Not only will I share the content I do for them, they will share my content and tag their friends. Also, through this process, I’ll improve upon what I do and this can lead to more engagement as the content is shared, talked about, laughed about, and enjoyed.

In оur fіrѕt two weeks on Instagram, wе wеnt frоm zero fоllоwеrѕ tо more than 10,000 bу following a set of rules that wе crafted.  Thеn, wіth ѕоmе еxреrіmеntаtіоn аnd еlbоw grease, wе wеnt from 10,000 followers to аmаѕѕіng mоrе than 2.5 million rеаl Instagram followers--setting uѕ uр аѕ оnе оf thе tор accounts іn оur nісhе. We’ve bееn аblе tо crush ѕаlеѕ and conversions, drаѕtісаllу increase оur оnlіnе еxроѕurе аnd аudіеnсе, and scale оur buѕіnеѕѕ аt a rate thаt’ѕ еxсееdеd thе nоrm аnd even оur own еxресtаtіоnѕ. In thе fоllоwіng соmрrеhеnѕіvе роѕt, we’ve оutlіnеd a ѕtер-bу-ѕtер guіdе оn how we dіd thіѕ аnd hоw уоu саn dо іt tоо. Aѕ Inѕtаgrаm аnd іtѕ аudіеnсе hаvе continued tо еvоlvе, ѕо have we. Wе’vе аltеrеd оur рlаnѕ аnd adapted оur mеthоdѕ to ѕее what sticks, and managed tо сlіmb thе lаddеr to 2.5 mіllіоn оrgаnіс fоllоwеrѕ. 1. Chооѕе Inѕtаgrаm Content Thаt’ѕ Rіght fоr Yоu Thіѕ part is going tо take ѕоmе thоught аnd еffоrt. Tо gаіn a hugе following of rеаl people on Inѕtаgrаm, уоu have to рrоduсе content that’s nоt оnlу mаdе specifically fоr Instagram but аlѕо content thаt’ѕ thе rіght fit for what your audience wаntѕ. Fіndіng the rіght аррrоасh аnd ѕtуlе is сruсіаl bесаuѕе іt’ѕ gоіng tо bесоmе thе wау уоur fоllоwеrѕ rесоgnіzе you. Generally speaking, there аrе types of іmаgеѕ that work well wіth a lоt оf industries; posters wіth inspirational оr humorous quotes, quality fооd рhоtоgrарhу, оr ѕсеnіс іmаgеѕ аrе ѕаfе ѕtаrtіng роіntѕ. Thаt bеіng ѕаіd, carefully consider what tуре оf content іt іѕ thаt уоu’rе producing. Yоu hаvе tо remember that Inѕtаgrаm іѕ ѕuсh a hit bесаuѕе іt’ѕ a whоllу unіԛuе platform, аnd thе еxреrіеnсе іt рrоvіdеѕ thе uѕеr іѕ соmрlеtеlу dіffеrеnt thаn something like Facebook or Twіttеr. 2. Crеаtіng Content Your Audіеnсе Will Lоvе аnd Interact Wіth Onсе you knоw what type of соntеnt is rіght for уоur brаnd, іt’ѕ tіmе tо really fосuѕ оn creating great роѕtѕ thаt you know аrе going to connect wіth уоur аudіеnсе. Thіѕ might ѕееm оbvіоuѕ, but we аlwауѕ ѕее thе соntеnt сrеаtіоn іtѕеlf gеttіng nеglесtеd. Find out whаt уоur сuѕtоmеrѕ еnjоу ѕееіng оn Inѕtаgrаm or whаt themes resonate wіth thеm, аnd populate уоur ассоunt with rеlеvаnt іmаgеѕ. But уоu’vе gоt tо connect wіth your аudіеnсе, ѕресіfісаllу. Remember, beauty іѕ іn thе еуе of the bеhоldеr. That’s why it’s ѕо crucial to dеvеlор a gооd rеlаtіоnѕhір wіth уоur аudіеnсе so уоu lеаrn whаt tуре оf content it іѕ thеу like. Thеrе hаvе bееn numеrоuѕ tіmеѕ whеn wе’vе posted ѕоmеthіng thаt we thоught wоuld аbѕоlutеlу crush іt wіth engagement, but it turnеd оut tо bе a dud. Other times wе’vе been lеft ѕсrаtсhіng оur hеаdѕ аѕ to whу this оnе post іѕ so рорulаr. 3. Trеаt Your Cоmmunіtу On Inѕtаgrаm Like Gold Onе оf the bіggеѕt mіѕtаkеѕ реорlе mаkе whеn building аn Inѕtаgrаm ассоunt іѕ thаt thеу оnlу еvеr ѕее thеіr fоllоwеrѕ аѕ numbers. It’ѕ easy tо become оbѕеѕѕеd with wаtсhіng numbеrѕ rаthеr thаn recognizing that еасh реrѕоn whо сhооѕеѕ tо follow уоu іѕ actually a rеаl реrѕоn. 4. Post оn Inѕtаgrаm Regularly Aіm tо роѕt оn a rеgulаr basis, аbоut once every thrее to fоur hours. Hоwеvеr, dоn’t bulk роѕt a whоlе bunсh оf рhоtоѕ іn оnе sitting; users will оftеn rеgаrd thіѕ аѕ spam аnd unfоllоw you. Think of іt lіkе ѕоwіng ѕееdѕ. 5. Thеrе’ѕ Gоld іn Yоur Instagram Bіо On Inѕtаgrаm, уоur bіо is a сruсіаl ріесе of rеаl еѕtаtе. Yоu саn best make uѕе оf thіѕ ѕесtіоn bу hаvіng a ѕtrоng саll tо асtіоn. You саn use uр tо 150 сhаrасtеrѕ, ѕо a short ѕnарру CTA wоrkѕ bеѕt. A ѕtrоng CTA ѕhоuld bе an аbѕоlutе nо-brаіnеr for уоur audience. Yоu аlrеаdу knоw thаt thеу can ѕее your соntеnt, ѕо mаkе іt wоrth thеіr while to асtuаllу tаkе a lооk at уоur bio bу оffеrіng ѕоmеthіng thаt you know thеу’ll lоvе. Tо create a ѕtrоng CTA, уоu wаnt tо bе аѕ ѕіmрlе and nо-nоnѕеnѕе as possible. Because уоu оnlу gеt оnе lіvе lіnk whеn іt соmеѕ tо Inѕtаgrаm, whісh іѕ іn уоur bіо, уоu want tо be аblе tо gеt as muсh vаluе as possible оut оf thаt lіnk.

ty4ta2a How do I get more followers on Instagram? With all social media the rules of success are fairly simple to state but they are all hinged on the single capricious luck of the dice being as one can do all the right things and yet still not have much of an effect, or conversely can be an alienating prick with thin content quality and still somehow capture some kitch quality that draws others to you. Barring an extreme demonstration of either good or bad luck, here are a few ways: Produce really good content.Champion a causerepresent an under represented group (similar to #2)Do something outside of Instagram which brings enough recognition that your name attached to an account gets you constant inquiry.Provide something that makes the life of the audience better for having received it.Network with others to create a pool audience to promote one another toBe whatever you are representing consistently and completelyHave the detachment to self promoteDont let #8 affect you contentFollow massive amounts of other people. A percentage of them will feel obligated to in turn follow you.Give meaningful feedback on the works of others.Specialize on something and cater to a crowd who enjoys that specializationThese are vague intentionally as they are not content specific. Take #4 for example: what you do could be a skill such a skydive in a wingsuit, a controversy like throwing your shoe at the president, or an accomplishment like winning a marathon, or an obscure occupation like biowaste cleanup specialist or an envied one like NFL Player or model. The specifics are irrelevant to the principles.

There’s lots of advice here explaining what you should do, so I’ll give you one thing you shouldn’t do: Don’t use any bots or software to buy followers. Here’s why: None of the followers you buy will interact or engage with you. Hardly any likes, no comments, and no valuable contributions.Your real followers will be able to tell. This reduces your credibility and makes you seem even less popular than before.You might be thinking, “why not just buy likes and comments too?” It’s a pretty easy way to boost your posts, right? No. This will create a cycle where you’re forced to buy more likes/comments on every post. If you stop, it’ll be obvious the previous posts were boosted. The engagement you pay for through bots won’t provide genuine value. The comments will usually be generic lines like “great post!” or thumbs up emojis — not real feedback. Here are statistics from a 4-month case study AdEspresso ran comparing real Instagram results to bot-run results (spending 100$ per month):  The real method (left) captured more than 3x as many visitors to the online store as the bot method (right). The bot method performed worse in visitors, sales, and engagement. The best way to gain real followers is to post more and increase the quality of your posts. Create a unique style that people will remember you by. Interact with other accounts and leave meaningful comments. Host giveaways and contests. Don’t buy followers.

A-Neglect what follower sellers tell you. Never buy fake followers. 1-Instagram and also Facebook has developed an algorithm to differentiate between fake and real followers. Facebook did it a few years ago and in one night most of the pages lost lost thousands of this fake followers :) On instagram, if you have fake followers your posts will not be at the ‘’top post’’ section since the algorithm measures percentage of engagement, not the amount of followers you have. If you are posting interesting content for your audience, you can be still featured at top section (with less than thousand followers) which will bring you exposure and followers. 2- Avarage Instagram user can understand which accounts have fake followers and which doesnt have. How? An account with 10k follower can not have 100 likes and 2 comments per post :) I dont know why you want followers but lets say if you are doing it 4 the sake of r brand, think about what will your real followers think about you when they find out that you bought fake followers. They can easily think that you are a fraud, they will not trust you and wont buy your service or product. B-Engagement will bring you followers. 1- For engagement, post original, interesting content. Give reason to people to follow you. 2- 2 posts per day is really enough. Dont post more than 3 content. 3-Plan your posts before you post them. Later is a good and free app 4 that. The posts in your gallery should be both individually interesting and/or beautiful and be interesting and/or beautiful all together. New follower candidates will look at your gallery before they decide.Think holistic! 4- Engage with your audience. Keep this in mind: ‘you can not get without giving’. If you engage with them, they will engage with you. Engage with your potential audience also! It is not TV, it is social media. So interaction is a must! C-Use niche hashtags. Common hashtags like paris have millions of posts and it is impossible to be a top post. Moreover it is very hard to be noticed by someone there. D- Most importantly, you or your service or your product should be original if you want to have more than 10k followers. If there is nothing special, think about it and invent one :) There are millions of insta accounts producing excessive content and most of them are very similar. If you can create original content, sooner or later you will be noticed!

You have an Instagram account, you’re posting regularly, you use #hashtags. Yet, no new followers are coming your way. I know how frustrating this can be, especially when you’re working hard to build a solid personal brand and hope to eventually leverage your Instagram account to earn extra cash. There’s no need to despair, however. There are several tactics you can use to boost engagement and build a larger following. First off, make sure you actually understand the basics. Yes, Instagram is fun to use, but if you’re struggling with follower count and want to do better, you need to take time to figure out what really works on Instagram and what doesn’t. There are several comprehensive online resources available. Once you’ve got the basics covered, direct your attention towards ways in which you can improve your Instagram activity and reach a wider audience.  Make sure your profile looks good as a whole Creating amazing individuals Instagram posts is the first step towards grabbing someone’s attention. Beyond that, though, you need to be mindful of how your profile looks overall. Your feed should have a cohesive look, as it’s the first thing a potential users sees when clicking on your username. This entails having a captivating profile photo, an engaging bio, a well-curated feed, and coordinating cover photos for your Instagram highlights. It sounds like a lot of work, but it’s worth it in the long run. Up your Instagram Stories game Stories generally have better engagement than posts, so you can use them to grab attention, share more about yourself, and reach a bigger audience: Consider using templates to make sure your stories look as good as possible;Use hashtags and Location tags - Instagram geo-locations and hashtags have their own stories attached to them, which are accessible to more people;Get creative and take advantage of all the editing features available on Insta stories – polls, questions, gifs, and so on.Write better captions A picture may be worth a thousand words, but when it comes to Instagram captions are just as important. Practice until you find your Instagram voice. It can feel weird at first, but you’ll eventually get better. You can use captions to describe the pictures in details, offer behind-the-scenes information, share more about your personal life. Additionally, ask your followers questions! This will offer them a prompt to comment and help you start a conversation. Cross-promote your Instagram account Think about any other marketing channels you can use to promote your Instagram to reach more people. Maybe you have a YouTube channel? Twitter account? Newsletter? Lead your existing followers from there to your Instagram page. You can even include your Instagram handle in your email signature. Collaborate with others Whenever possible, reach out to like-minded Instagram users and see if there are any ways in which you can team up. Maybe you can host a giveaway together? Work on a project that would benefit you both – like taking part in a challenge? If you’re shy about reaching out, consider interacting with more influencers in your niche by commenting on their photos/stories. Turn on notifications and make sure you comment with something relevant when they post something new. That way, the people who comment after you may click on your profile if they find your words inspiring or helpful. Invest in your account While you might not be willing to invest in promoted posts if you’re using Instagram as a hobby, it’s worth looking into ads when you want to bring things to the next level. Instagram is very competitive and ads can help you stand out from the crowd. You don’t even need to have a hefty budget as long as you learn how to effectively target your ads to the right people. There are different types of Instagram ads available, from feed-style images to promoted Instagram Stories. You just need to figure out which one is right for you.

Wаnt tо knоw how tо gеt frее Inѕtаgrаm followers Gо аnd ѕеаrсh Fоr Ingrаmbоt(DOT)соm. Whеn уоu do, there's a gооd сhаnсе thеу'll look аt уоur profile. To uѕе Instagram еffесtіvеlу, уоu nееd tо buіld a ѕоlіd bаѕе of Instagram followers. But іt саn bе trісkу for brаndѕ tо fіgurе оut еxасtlу how to mаkе thаt happen. Thе dауѕ оf shortcuts lіkе buуіng followers оr uѕіng bоtѕ аrе over. Thеѕе trісkѕ mіght boost уоur fоllоwеr count fоr a ѕhоrt tіmе, but they won’t do you any favors long-term. Thаt’ѕ because thе only truly vаluаblе Instagram fоllоwеrѕ аrе real реорlе whо саrе аbоut аnd еngаgе wіth your brаnd. A false follower соunt mіght boost уоur ego, but it wоn’t hеlр уоur Inѕtаgrаm strategy. Clісk on any tір below tо lеаrn more, оr keep ѕсrоllіng fоr thе соmрlеtе lіѕt of ways tо get fоllоwеrѕ оn Instagram for frее. How tо gеt fоllоwеrѕ оn Inѕtаgrаm fоr free Hоw tо gеt Instagram fоllоwеrѕ for frее 1. Have a thoughtful Instagram ѕtrаtеgу Tо uѕе аnу social nеtwоrk еffесtіvеlу, you need a clear рlаn. Gеttіng mоrе Inѕtаgrаm fоllоwеrѕ is a great gоаl tо ѕtаrt wіth. But fоllоwеrѕ аlоnе wоn’t gіvе уоu a successful Instagram ассоunt. Gаіnіng fоllоwеrѕ nееdѕ to bе part оf a lаrgеr рlаn that connects tо your buѕіnеѕѕ ѕtrаtеgу and ѕосіаl mаrkеtіng objectives. Think аbоut the rеаѕоnѕ whу уоu wаnt mоrе Inѕtаgrаm followers. Whаt do you rеаllу hоре tо ассоmрlіѕh? Maybe уоu wаnt tо: іnсrеаѕе brаnd аwаrеnеѕѕboost рrоduсt ѕаlеѕdrive traffic tо уоur website.Staying focused оn these buѕіnеѕѕ-оrіеntеd gоаlѕ wіll hеlр kеер уоur Inѕtаgrаm account соnѕіѕtеnt. It wіll help уоu tell a соmреllіng brand story thаt арреаlѕ to nеw profile visitors and hеlрѕ build (аnd keep) a loyal fоllоwіng. 2. Dеfіnе уоur tаrgеt аudіеnсе Aѕk уоurѕеlf ѕоmе ԛuеѕtіоnѕ аbоut whо you аrе trying to rеасh: Hоw old аrе thеу?Where dо thеу lіvе?What do thеу dо for work?Whеn аnd hоw dо thеу uѕе Instagram?Whаt аrе thеіr pain points and сhаllеngеѕ?Answering thеѕе ԛuеѕtіоnѕ wіll help you craft thе rіght kіnd оf Inѕtаgrаm соntеnt tо rеасh thе реорlе оn Instagram whо аrе mоѕt likely tо gіvе уоu a follow. It wіll also keep you fосuѕеd оn thе needs of your tаrgеt аudіеnсе so уоu can соnѕіѕtеntlу dеlіvеr соntеnt thаt mаkеѕ thеm want tо kеер fоllоwіng you fоr thе lоng tеrm. 3. Crеаtе a соnѕіѕtеnt brаnd ѕtоrу аnd aesthetic Mауbе уоu want to ѕаtіѕfу curiosity bу ѕhоwіng off hоw уоur рrоduсt is mаdе. Or ѕhаrе аn еmрlоуее’ѕ реrѕресtіvе to humanize уоur brand. If уоu wаnt tо роѕіtіоn your brаnd іn an aspirational way, уоu could try showcasing the lіfеѕtуlе оr асhіеvеmеntѕ оf уоur сuѕtоmеrѕ. No mаttеr what уоu wаnt tо achieve, it’s іmроrtаnt tо mаіntаіn a соnѕіѕtеnt brаnd реrѕоnаlіtу аnd look. Yоur роѕtѕ should bе еаѕіlу rесоgnіzаblе аt a glance. Thіnk оf уоur Inѕtаgrаm grіd as оnе cohesive unіt. Yоu саn always uѕе Inѕtаgrаm Stоrіеѕ tо share соntеnt thаt dоеѕn’t ԛuіtе fіt with thе lооk and fееl оf уоur mаіn fееd. 4. Use kеуwоrdѕ tо appear in searches Bеfоrе реорlе саn fоllоw уоu оn Inѕtаgrаm, thеу hаvе tо fіnd уоu. Nоt a lоt оf thе text оn Inѕtаgrаm is ѕеаrсhаblе. In fact, оnlу twо fields оn Instagram соntrіbutе tо ѕеаrсh rеѕultѕ: nаmе аnd username. Yоur username іѕ уоur Instagram hаndlе. It’s a gооd idea to mаkе іt consistent wіth thе hаndlе уоu uѕе оn other ѕосіаl nеtwоrkѕ, since thіѕ аlѕо makes іt easier fоr реорlе tо fіnd уоu. Uѕе your brаnd nаmе or a vаrіаtіоn of уоur name thаt реорlе аrе likely tо use whеn ѕеаrсhіng fоr уоur brаnd. Yоur nаmе саn bе anything уоu lіkе, uр tо 30 сhаrасtеrѕ. Kеуwоrd ѕtuffіng is nеvеr a gооd іdеа, but іt саn bе useful to include уоur mоѕt rеlеvаnt kеуwоrd іn thе name fіеld to іmрrоvе dіѕсоvеrаbіlіtу bаѕеd on search. Fоr example, trаvеl wrіtеr Clаudіа Lаrоуе (@thetravellingmom) іnсludеѕ thе keyphrase “travel wrіtеr” іn hеr Inѕtаgrаm nаmе, upping thе chance ѕhе’ll bе dіѕсоvеrеd bу those looking for trаvеl соntеnt in gеnеrаl аnd travel wrіtеrѕ in раrtісulаr. 5. Uѕе rеlеvаnt hаѕhtаgѕ to reach nеw uѕеrѕ Wе juѕt ѕаіd thаt thе text of уоur Instagram posts іѕn’t searchable. But hashtags dо арреаr іn Inѕtаgrаm search. That mеаnѕ uѕіng hashtags thоughtfullу саn bе a gооd wау tо get fоllоwеrѕ оn Inѕtаgrаm fоr frее. Inсludіng relevant hashtags саn help реорlе fіnd уоur content аftеr a ѕеаrсh, or after clicking on a hаѕhtаg from аnоthеr relevant роѕt. Inѕtаgrаm users саn аlѕо fоllоw hаѕhtаgѕ, ѕо уоur hashtagged соntеnt mау appear іn fееdѕ of реорlе whо dо nоt уеt follow уоur ассоunt. Yоu can іnсludе up tо 30 hаѕhtаgѕ іn аn Inѕtаgrаm роѕt, but hаѕhtаgѕ аrе often mоrе effective bаѕеd оn ԛuаlіtу rаthеr than ԛuаntіtу. Dо ѕоmе еxреrіmеntіng to lеаrn how mаnу hashtags wоrk bеѕt fоr уоur раrtісulаr ассоunt. Avoid hаѕhtаg gіmmісkѕ ѕuсh as #lіkеfоrlіkе, #tаgѕfоrlіkеѕ, оr #fоllоwmе. These mау give you a temporary bооѕt іn followers. But they wіll lіkеlу bе bots оr реорlе only interested in bеіng followed bасk. And that won’t hеlр уоu buіld a mеаnіngful, еngаgеd community on Instagram. Inѕtеаd, fосuѕ оn uѕіng hіghlу tаrgеtеd hаѕhtаgѕ ѕресіfіс tо уоur рhоtо, рrоduсt, оr buѕіnеѕѕ, lіkе ѕtуlіѕt Dее Cаmрlіng dоеѕ in thіѕ #wfh ѕhоt.

Well, I wont make this answer very long so that you are able to gain much in a limited amount of time and not lose interest. So here are few tips to organically increase your followers :- Start using hashtags, as Instagram allows you to use 30 hashtags per post but it is advisable that you use a bit less. The hashtags should be relevant to your post and try using different hashtags for every post. You can always check which hashtag works more for you by comparing the engagement in different posts.Follow different Instagram profiles related to your business or interest. You should ideally follow 30 profiles per hour and it’ll definitely yield a 20–30% follow back.Keep liking other’s pictures and try leaving a cheerful comment on their pics. This will help in making them visit your profile and maybe return the favor.Post good quality pictures. The better the post, the more engagement it will generate.Try using hashtags like “likeforlike” , “followforfollow” , “gaintrain” etc.Use hashtags even in your stories. Instagram stories have proven to be a great success and have wide reach. You can definitely use stories along with location filters to reach more people from within your location.Post about 2–3 times a day, not more than that.Consistency is the key, post regularly and avoid giving long gaps (weeks) between posts.Try engaging more people by having CTA ( call to action) on your posts. For eg :- asking them to tag xyz, using the Poll feature of Instagram.Hope this helps. If you need more information, do let me know. Cheers!

response.answer_text: I will make this short, and I will make this quick. There is only one way to do so get more followers on Instagram: Quality Content. I’ll break this down. Fun Fact: The first photo on Instagram was shared by co-founder Kevin Systrom of his wife’s foot and a dog in July 2010. Instagram is today the world’s largest photo sharing up, and you know what they say about pictures right? It is worth a thousand words. Ever since Facebook acquired Instagram, it has only grown. You can share pictures, from right where you are with your friends, have your own pictorial blog space, and in recent times, you can go LIVE on video and post stories. Not only that, you can follow celebrities, see what they are doing and get the sense of actually knowing them. It is a world in its own. Instagram has attracted tons of marketers and influencers, and wherever there are marketers and influencers, there is always a need to have a large audience base online, whether it is for yourself or the businesses you are working with. Now, how to do you get a following? You look around, and it seems relatively straightforward at times, while at other times, it seems impossible. Here is my process of creating Instagram pages which gain high volumes of traffic and likes. #1. START A PAGE ABOUT WHAT YOU LOVE. I understand if a lot of your decisions would be driven by the need for money, trends you see around and trying to replicate what 500 other profiles are doing. There is nothing wrong in that. Similar ideas in the digital world can co-exist but can only sustain via passion. Let’s say you are a Digital Marketing Professional and you know you can sit and talk about it for hours. Well, that is a great niche to be in. There are two reasons to start with what you love. You will remain active for longerIt would not feel like a chore#2. QUALITY REALLY MATTERS If you keep the quality high of your content, know that you have set yourself apart by 50% already. This quality is not just about good content, but unusual context too. Be informative and very very visually appealing. You will understand the difference over time, but to start, be sure your content is on point. #3. AUTHENTICITY People want authenticity. They want to be able to resonate with someone who is a lot like them. It brings in a lot of warmth. Half of the people we follow on Instagram is because yes, they are famous, but they are just like us. They think the same things; they spend their day the same way. Adding value to someone's life is all you need to focus on. Look at Gary Vaynerchuk; the guy has motivated so many people to bring the best out in themselves, only because he tells you what no one else would, and you love it. #4. HASHTAGS This is important. Platforms like Triberr allow you to know which hashtags are banned and which aren’t. A lot of the fashion hashtags get scrutinized for no reason, so, be sure to use such tools. Usually, I tend to use up to 25-30 keywords per post. Opt for keywords which have posted, under a million. Anything over, you are sliming your chances, unless, you already have 200K followers. #5. FIND A COMMUNITY Whichever industry you are targeting, at least one other person is in it. Follow up and see if the situation allows you to work on s4s (share for share) basis. This will get you and the community member more exposure. #6. STORIES ARE AMAZING A lot of the major influencers on Instagram, do not want to disrupt their newsfeed with content which does not entirely resonate with their content strategy. However, some so many famous people have zero issues with reposting your story. Feature Each > Tag Them > Follow Up #7. ENGAGEMENT Ah, the most underestimated strategic move which many still find to be useless. Assuming that I visit your profile and comment, ‘Your Feed is Amazing.’ Have the courtesy to respond! In a minute, day, week, month or year, respond! #8. CONSISTENCY Finally, the last bit in the puzzle. If you have 1,000 followers on Instagram, and you become inactive, you are certainly going to see a decrease in your following. This is because people tend to follow you for a reason, which is content and if they don’t see regular updates, they don’t want to support you. Post at least three times a day, seven days a week, and you will see change. Instagram is not magic, and you are not a celebrity, yet. It takes time. Put in the effort. You’ll be fine.

Growing your account on Instagram is both difficult and time consuming, but with enough diligent effort you can inevitably grow your account steadily over time. Here’s what I think you can do to grow your account without Hashtags (although I feel they are quite important to IG growth). First this is what not to do; Don’t use Follow/Unfollow. I know.. I’m going against what a lot of people say but hear me out. This method was great 3–4 years ago, before Instagram had such a sophisticated algorithm. Now it’s almost inevitable your account will be labeled as a spam account. IG’s system categorizes accounts based on 3 criteria; Spam, User, Influencer. If you’re following and unfollowing 300, 400, 500 accounts a day, then the system realizes that this is not “normal” human behaviour. Nobody really uses IG in that nature, unless they’re a bot. IG hates bots and makes it an effort to shutdown those automated social media tools everyday.Another reason Why F/U method is not the greatest is because of it’s basis; people will ONLY follow you back as a courtesy and not because they truly love your content. This doesn’t build an engaged audience as they are mindlessly following whoever follows them. Then your account will become more of tool rather than a vehicle to share your content. 2. Don’t pay for or buy fake followers. This is bad because it’s something that is going to ruin your accounts engagement rate in the long run. ER (engagement rate) is the average likes+comments you get on your posts / your follower amount. Most decent engagement rates hang around 3%-5%. Now What you should do. Post Great content consistently. Social Media is to share content and it’s the basis of what keeps these platforms alive. If you’re not feeding your account with the fuel it needs to run properly, you can’t expext any sort of decent following what so ever.Post at the right times. User apps such as UNUM (iOS/Android) to see what your best time are, so that you can get the most engagement and get more exposure.Create or get invited to DM Groups. Reach out to accounts in your niche and create what’s called a DM Group. These are groups that are made on the app itself, 15 max, in which all participants agree to like+comment on each others posts as soon as possible.Use relevant hashtags. Hashtags are the basis of exposure on social media, as people that are interested in certain topics use them to look for stuff they’re interested in. Start by looking at what tags accounts you look up to use and then start compiling a list of related ones. Make sure to circulate your tags as you don’t want to be shadowbanned for using the same ones repetitively.Use these tips and I’m sure your account will grow!

Instagram is all about showing off a way of life and using glamorous looking pictures to make your products and services incredibly desirable. While this is true though, it’s also only one part of how you can use Instagram to succeed and grow your business. At the end of the day, you can have the most inspiring Instagram account in the world but if no one knows about it, you aren’t going to be selling many products! So, the question is: how do you go about growing your Instagram account and how do you make sure that you find the right followers? Read on and we’ll look at some of the best strategies you can use. Integrating Your Instagram With Your Existing Marketing Hopefully, you will already have some form of marketing and this will most likely involve a website, a Facebook account, Twitter and more. One thing you can do right away to grow your Instagram account then, is to bring in visitors from those other channels. One simple way to do this is to add a button on your website that people can click in order to follow you on Instagram. This way, the more people you bring to your website, the more you will be able to grow your Instagram account. This will then also work in reverse; so that as your Instagram account grows, you are able to send more and more people back to your website! Likewise, use IFTTT (If This, Then That) in order to publish your Instagram pictures straight to your Twitter account. You can also get plugins that will show your Instagram pictures in the sidebar on your website, thereby helping more people to see the kind of content you are sharing there. Ask People to Follow You! This sounds a little too simplistic to be effective but in fact that is exactly why this is such a good strategy! One of the very best ways to get more people to follow you on Instagram is simply to ask them to go and check out your page. Just say at the end of your next YouTube video: ‘why not check out my account over at Instagram?’. You can do the same thing with blog posts. Socializing At the end of the day, Instagram is a social media platform and that means that it is a communication tool. Use it as such by making sure to comment on photos that other users have taken or to like them. Research shows that Instagram users find it flattering when brands like their pictures. And chances are that when they are flattered, they will want to check out exactly who it is that likes their photos! Influencer Marketing One of the very most effective ways to grow on Instagram though is to team up with other creators and to promote each other. This is called Instagram marketing and when done well, it will give you instant access to a huge audience that the other creator has spent time growing.

Every other day is a good cycle.Go with one theme, or have a system with various ones, but something that's pretty to look at when your profile is viewed. Good luck on growing your Instagram!

Instagram has an excellent user engagement rate in addition to being a lot of fun to use. It is actually a very good example of a successful startup company. Along with Twitter and Facebook, Instagram is one of the most startup-friendly of the all social networks out there for new businesses in numerous markets, but particularly for those whose focus is on visual services and products. So whether you are selling interior decoration services, handcrafted products or some other kind of service or product, Instagram can assist you with getting your startup better known and providing it with more visibility. Here are the following 10 Easy & Effective Instagram Marketing Tips: 1. Post a minimum of one to two times per day One of the best things you can do to increase engagement is to keep your Instagram feed active. If you have a lot of interesting videos or images to share you can post more frequently than that - many of the large brands that are active on Instagram actually post numerous times per day.  However you should allow at least a couple of hours in between updates so that your audience isn't overwhelmed with too much content, or even worse, make you seem spammy. After you have established your posting schedule, be sure to stick to it, so you can help build a feeling of expectancy. 2. Get the best use from your profile link Given the fact that Instagram allows you just one link - make sure that you choose it carefully. A safe approach for driving additional traffic to your website is to add the link to your blog or homepage of your website in your Instagram profile. However, whenever you have a new social media that you want to promote, or have an upcoming event or are planning on running a special campaign, you might want to use your link for directing your followers to a special landing page that you have set up. 3. Add hashtags and captions to your images Make sure your captions are concise and add relevant hashtags to blend in with them so that it is easier to discover your Instagram content. According to studies, more engagement is generated by posts that have about 10 hashtags compared to those with more or fewer hashtags. Keep in mind that if you use too many hashtags their power will be diluted and your followers may end up getting confused. 4. Carefully choose your hashtags  When you are using hashtags, it is important to find the right combination between using tags that relate to your start up, trending hashtags, and hashtags that are descriptive of the theme and content of your post. The most important thing is watching your hashtag closely as well as the engagement that is generated by them, and to tweak them over time as needed. 5. Take square pictures In Instagram it is easier to scale down and crop square pictures while making sure that elements don't disappear. So whether you are using your digital camera or phone on your iPhone to take your Instagram-bound photos, there is an option for taking square pictures on your device. 6. Respond to mentions and comments Like any other social network, when you connect with your followers and fans it helps keep your Instagram page lively and increases engagement. Whenever you are replying to comments, you should answer the questions in the order that you receive them, and when resolving complaints do you best to do so in a friendly way. Also, respond to thoughtful comments, even if there isn't much for you to add - it will show you care about and listen to your followers and help you get more likes for your account. 7. Make exclusive offers A very effective way to show your appreciation for followers and drive engagement is to provide them with Instagram-only exclusive offers that they can't get anyplace else. Get as creative as possible with these. 8. Run image-based contests Instagram is perfect for image-based contests since a high percentage of the users there are mobile and own convenient smartphone cameras. You can ask your customers to take pictures of themselves while using your product in unusual ways or share what their reaction was after they used your services. Contest are very social in nature and a lot of fun, so people will be very attracted to them, as long as you offer some freebies and nice prizes. 9. Curate content It is much easier to curate content on Instagram compare to other social networks. You can regramm interesting photos that are relevant to your niche that individuals and organizations share (other than your director competitors). You can also share images that your followers have instagrammed. 10. Use analytics for monitoring your numbers  Monitor activity patterns, regramms, comments, geotags and hashtags. Using the basic analytics that Instagram provides is a good place. You can always transition over to more advanced analytics later. Read full post here…

Be funny, ironic, or outrageous--just don't be BORING.

There is an easy way and a not so easy one. People who only want to see their numbers grow oftentimes gain followers by buying them, usually using some kind of an app for that. Such practices will increase the number of your followers in an instant, however these followers will not be legitimate. These will not be the people you want to target. Bots, fake accounts and users who like to play the follow/unfollow game are not your goal. This is not how you want to approach this platform. Concentrate on acquiring real followers! It may be a long, arduous process, but it can also be quite fun and fulfilling along the way :) Here are a few tips on gaining followers on Instagram: Make your profile look cool and include all the relevant information:Set an appealing and relevant profile picture, be it your company’s logo or a picture of you if you’re running a personal account. Keep in mind that quality of the visuals matter, so avoid any blurred or pixelated content!When it comes to writing your profile bio, try to keep it concise yet as helpful and insightful as it can be. Include emojis and a link to your landing page: Let others know your presence.Follow brands and individuals from your industry or fields of interest, post comments under their posts, hit that like button under their stuff, etc.Quality over quantity, but quantity is important too!When it comes to posting your own content, try to make it look as good as possible. Visuals should be of great quality, captions work best if there is a little story behind them enriched with emojis, so that other users can find your stuff relatable or even inspirational:Utilize hashtags. You can check which ones are the most common while creating your post or you can use the hashtag browser: If you use a social media management tool such as NapoleonCat, you can see which of your hashtags perform better in the “hashtag cloud’’:  You can also see their performance in numbers by comments, likes and engagement rate. Make use of additional Instagram features.Instagram Stories, live feeds, IGTV can all help you drive that traffic even more. People love live content, so these features, especially Stories and live feeds, can prove very useful in growing your Instagram account.Stay consistent.You have to post regularly if you want more attention. Instagram posts have a limited “longevity” so it’s best to post at least every day.Monitor your changes and learn!It’s best to analyze your data. You can do that using Instagram Insights which are available to business profiles. However, for more in-depth analytics, I would recommend NapoleonCat.com.*BONUS METHOD* Call it an organic Instagram hack - going viral. There are indeed ways you can partly skip/exponentially speed up the process of acquiring followers, however such cases are rare. Some examples of actions making people rapidly gain real followers: taking part in all sorts of TV showsengaging in personal relationships with celebritiesgoing viral on YouTube or other social media, oftentimes by accidentpartnering with famous bloggers, vloggers, etc.

Instagram quickly outgrew its first impression as a fun app for kids and has become a serious content marketing, selling, networking and audience building tool for individuals and brands. It's one of the most popular social networking sites on the planet, with over 200 million active monthly members sharing 60 million images and 1.6 billion likes per day. Just how awesome is it? Engagement rates for brands on most social networks are less than 0.1%, but Instagram blows them all away. The average Instagram engagement rate for brands in a 2014 Forrester study was an epic 58 times higher than on Facebook.  You can't argue with numbers like that. But that's just average. And as I advocate across all manners of online marketing, you don't want to be average! It's not a dream or a goal. Sure, 58 times greater engagement than Facebook sounds great, but you can do so much better than that on Instagram. Whether you're a big brand or maybe just wondering how to become Instagram famous, I don't want you to strive for average; I want you to reach for the stars and become an Instagram unicorn. A digital unicorn is that magical, rare creature that outperforms all others by orders of magnitude. And you're going to accomplish this by working these eleven amazing Instagram hacks into your social strategy. Check out these attention-getting ideas for your Instagram captions, hashtags, profile, and more, and see what to post on Instagram to get more followers and way more visibility and engagement too. 1. Cross-promote your dedicated hashtag. That's nice that you created a #joesgarage hashtag for your company, but who knows to use it to share content about you? Make sure it's in your profile, but take the game offline and have it printed on your receipts, in print ads, on signage in your store and at relevant events  If you're on radio and TV, direct people to use your hashtag. Integrate online and offline campaigns by ensuring it's listed on your other social profiles, on your website, and in your email blasts. Don't just hope people will find it. 2. Get creative with hashtagging. When it comes to Instagram caption ideas, you need to look beyond the one-word, obvious hashtags. Sure, you want to use those, too, but mix it up and use hashtags to tell part of your story. Be funny, ironic, or outrageous--just don't be BORING. Collaborative workspace company WeWork is great at this, and they include a fun mix of Instagram content, too.  3. Participate in massively popular conversations. For every post, use a mix of topically relevant hashtags such as #woodworking for a carpentry company, for example, as well as trending, super-popular hashtags wherever you can.  The really specific hashtags are like long-tail keywords in that they show more intent and help you find the right people, but the universally trending hashtags like #instagood, #tbt, #photooftheday or even plain old #fun get you in front of more people in general. You need both to make it on a social network as big and noisy as Instagram. 4. Make the most of your bio URL. It's prime real estate on your Instagram profile... do you really want your bio to only link to your website homepage, now and forever? Yawn. Change it up at least bi-weekly and use that clickable link in your bio to drive traffic to your newest or most popular content. 5. Get descriptive with your captions. A picture is worth a thousand words, but you can't skip the words entirely. National Geographic is fantastic at using storytelling alongside their Instagram photos to generate engagement and sharing. While traditional media brands have dropped like flies, NatGeo has thrived across digital and become one of the top brands on Instagram, with over 50 million followers.  Like the other Instagram hacks I've included here, this is something you'll want to commit to working into your strategy over time, so don't worry if it feels weird at first. Your writing will improve as you find your brand's Instagram voice. 6. Go all in on influencer marketing. Visit the profiles of each person you've identified as an influencer in your space (AKA a person who influences the people you want to get in front of) and "Turn On Post Notifications" to be notified every time they share new content. You can then interact with them regularly and become one of their favorite people or brands.  7. Remove unwanted tagged photos of you from your profile. If you only want to feature the best user-generated content about you or your brand on your Instagram profile, you can. Now, you can't remove the tagged photos from the site entirely, by choosing "Edit Tags," selecting the ones you want to remove and choosing "Hide from Profile" (you may need to confirm). It does the trick. 8. Approve photo tags before the content shows on your profile. Speaking of giving you greater control over which tagged photos appear on your profile, you can change your Instagram setting so tagged photos won't show unless you approve them first. You'll find this under "Options," "Photos of You," and "Add Manually."  I'm trying to think of a reason why any company would NOT want to do this... Nope. I've got nothing. You should absolutely set this up to avoid potentially embarrassing situations. 9. Develop your own Instagram style. It's human nature to want to fit in, but on Instagram, you want to stand out. Indian beverage brand Frooti has developed such a unique visual content style, it's instantly recognizable every time a user sees a Frooti post in their newsfeed. Check it out:  10. Get local. See what's going on in a specific area (say, your neighborhood, a city you're targeting in ads, or even an event in a certain location) by going to the search page and choosing the Places tab. Then, type in the name of the place to see all geotagged posts for that location.  11. Remember your calls to action! Instagram, like other social networks, is a conversation, not a broadcasting platform. What action do you want people to take on your post? If you don't know that, start over and figure it out. Staples is great at generating engagement by letting people know exactly what they expect them to do with their posts (bonus points if you make it sound fun). Often, that call to action cleverly gets people to share or virally spread Staples' content. How to Get More Followers on Instagram [Summary] To get more followers on Instagram do the following things: Promote your dedicated hashtag on your other social profiles, on your website, and your email blast.Get creative with your hashtags. Be funny, ironic, or outrageous – but never boring!Watch topically relevant and trending hashtags. Join these conversations to get in front of more people.Use your bio link to drive traffic to your newest or most popular content.Write descriptive captions. Storytelling will help generate engagement and sharing.Interact with top influencers in your space and try to become one of their favorite people or brands.Don't want a tagged photo of you or your brand on your profile? Edit Tags to hide images from your profile.Adjust your settings so any potentially embarrassing tagged photos won't show without your approval.Develop your own unique, recognizable visual style. Figure out how you want to stand out and make it so!Visit the Places tab to see what's happening locally - your neighborhood, a city you're targeting in ads, or an event in a certain location.Use a call to action to tell people what you want them to do with your posts. Find clever ways to get people to share your content.Are you marketing your business on Instagram? Do you have a favorite Instagram hack or trick to share? Leave yours in the comments below! This article was originally published at WordStream: Online Advertising Made Easy

Here's what I can think of coming off the top of my head: Use hashtags that relate to your posts! That way, when people visit these, they may stumble upon one of your posts that interests them and prompts them to follow you.Don't post too frequently or unfrequently. Try to post at least once every 2–3 weeks and once per day at the most. People are more likely to unfollow you if they see that you're clogging up their feed with so many posts that they can't see anyone else’s. On the other hand, it's hard to gain any followers if you are inactive and don't post very much at all.Follow accounts that interest you and comment on their posts. When others see an interesting comment, they may be prompted to check out the account that wrote it.Give other accounts with a similar amount of followers shoutouts and have them do the same for you. This could simply mean mentioning their username in the caption of one of your pictures. (Example: Hey, if you like my posts, you'll probably also enjoy @example123. Go give them a follow!)II hope this helped!

Craft a great bio and profile Your profile is the backbone of your presence on Instagram, and a well-crafted one is key to growing your audience. Two-thirds of Instagram business profile visits are from non-followers. Your profile needs to convince those new views to click the follow button. They won’t do so if your profile is unclear, incomplete, or unappealing. Here’s what you can include in your profile: Name: Up to 30 characters, and included in Instagram search, so you may wish to include a keyword. Username: Make it the same as your other social channels. This will make it easy for your followers on other platforms to find you on Instagram. Website: The only place on Instagram where you can include a clickable link (aside from calls to action in ads or swiping up on Stories). Bio: 150 characters to convey your brand identity and show new visitors why they should follow you. Share engaging content Great content gets people to like, comment on, and share your posts. That engagement gives you an Instagram algorithm boost and helps you get more reach and new followers. Everything you post must be interesting to your target audience. Your goal is to inform, engage, and entertain them with content. Your visuals must be compelling and your captions engaging.

Trying to attract more followers solely on the basis of being a ‘people pleaser’ may indirectly cause the loss of bits and pieces of yourself. Having a distinct style on Instagram is the result of being confident in your own individualism—not on what everyone else is doing. While inspiration can be found in other people—it is a piece of them, it signifies them. On the internet there are so many people doing so many different things—we have this idea that we should learn from everyone. This creates much emulation—which differs from the vanilla creativity that might originate from someone left to their own propensity. People will follow you if they see that you are not another emulation. The stuff that you post is fresh and does not follow a model except of your own devising. It can’t be traced back to a recent trendsetter—because you are the trendsetter. When other people emulate you—it will be traced back to you. Now it may be possible to say that two Instagram accounts post much alike—but as long as they aren’t clearly staggered, it would seem that they are on the same creative wavelength. Everyone gets ideas—execution is what differentiates the great ones.

Providing you with 3 best ways to get fast followers in Instagram. 1.Incorporate hashtags. Yes, hashtags. They’re a polarizing strategy because it’s easy to cross a line here, but the fact is, they’re the best way to get your content discovered by new audiences, hands-down. People search for and follow hashtags for their favorite topics, and if they search for yours, your post will get in front of them. Your existing followers will see your posts in their newsfeeds, but your ideal post should include hashtags to attract the people who don’t follow you. There are only two lines you need to be wary not to cross: Relevance. Whatever hashtags you use, make sure you’re using them appropriately. If you try to exploit a hashtag that you don’t fully understand, you could wind up alienating your audience or seeming ignorant. If you’re in doubt, do your research. If you’re still in doubt, drop it.Volume. Don’t stuff your post full of hashtags for the sake of stuffing it full of hashtags. This turns users off almost immediately. Instead, select only a handful that you feel are most appropriate for your post.2.Tag people. This is more common for individual users than it is for brands, but tagging specific people can be a good way to increase your visibility, so I’m counting it as part of the “perfect” Instagram post. For example, you could feature a contribution or a member of your audience specifically and call them out as a way to bond with them. It’ll also make it likely they’ll share it with their own audience: If that doesn’t work, you can select specific people in your audience you feel the post would be relevant for, or if you’re really strapped, you could simply call out the individual accounts of your employees and team members. The key is to include some form of engagement that makes your post more accessible. 3.Miscellaneous quirks. In addition to the best practices I listed above, there are a handful of other, less obvious quirks about Instagram that could help you craft the ideal post: Blue images get more likes. According to a recent study, images with blue tones tend to get more likes than those with red or other color tones. If you can, try to post more images with a sense of “blue” about them, with the color dominating the majority of the image’s area.

This is a topic that can last us for days to discuss as there are a LOT of strategies and growth hacking techniques out there. However, I’d love to give you the techniques that I did to grow my Instagram account organically. (These are just bullet points and some points need more of an in depth discussion. Feel free to send me a message if you have any questions :)) Make sure your Instagram is fully optimized. Review your bio if it’s missing some hashtags, keywords or location that will enable people to find you easier and faster.Determine the niche your account belongs to. Then follow similar accounts that fall into the same niche. Your account will then be featured as a suggested account to follow to people who are looking for relevant accounts within a specific niche.Content! Instagram is a visual platform. It’s no secret that you should post high quality content on your account. People are more likely to follow an account if they find that the content posted on it is either relevant, entertaining, relatable, trending, valuable and informative.Be consistent in posting. Post at least once a day in your feed and stories. Don’t forget to include a relevant number of hashtags to optimize the post. Location tags and branded tags help in exposure too! If you’re posting everyday at 7am in the morning, stick to that schedule.Instagram’s algorithm for 2019 has placed a huge importance on genuine and authentic conversations. Therefore, engagement, engagement, engagement is key! If possible, do not use bots to engage as it only attracts bot accounts or fake accounts. Consistent comments and reactions to other people’s content will boost your account’s exposure.BONUS TIP: There is this one technique that I watched from Neil Patel’s videos. He mentioned that following 30 accounts within 30 minutes will increase your follower base. Upvote if you find this helpful. :) Thank you!

Instagram Hashtags Not Working Whilst hashtags truly are an amazing feature for getting attention to your Instagram posts, sometimes they just don’t work. If you’ve just spent a load of time coming up with the best hashtags that suit your image, only to find that they aren’t working, it can be incredibly frustrating. This post will discuss the four possible reasons why your hashtags aren’t working and how to fix them. 1. The hashtag you’re trying to use is banned. Instagram is very sensitive about the content it lets people post on its platform. There are actually over 114,000 banned hashtags, and many of them will surprise you as they seem completely normal to most people. If your hashtags uses a controversial keyword, even if you think it’s not that bad, it may be the reason why the hashtag isn’t working. The best way to check if your hashtag is banned is to search for it on Instagram. If your hashtag shows up, then it’s not banned. If it doesn’t show up, then it’s most likely banned:  2. There’s a Bug With Your App Whilst Instagram usually works well most of the time, occasionally your app can develop a bug which stops certain features from working properly. The quickest way to get rid of any glitch that your app may be having is to reset the cache. It only takes about 30 seconds do this and it should fix any issue that you’re having with hashtags. Here’s how to do it:  As it explains in the image above, once you get to this page just tap ‘Offload App’ to clear the cache:  3. You need to re log into your account. If the cause of your hashtags not working is to do with your account, rather than your app, the relogging will refresh the data that Instagram has stored on their servers. Therefore, logging out and logging back in again is another potential fix for the problem. 4. There is a problem on Instagram’s side related to hashtag posting. Sometimes, Instagram can have problems with their servers, which can cause certain functionalities such as hashtags to not work. Unfortunately, there’s not much you can do about this, and you’ll simply have to wait for Instagram to fix the issue. Fortunately, Instagram is pretty quick at sorting these issues out, so try checking again in 30 minutes or so. Conclusion So there you have it. These are all of the potential causes and fixes for Instagram hashtags not working. If you have tried all of the steps above, and none of them seem to be working, then it may be worth reinstalling the Instagram app as a final attempt to get it fixed. Also, you can try contacting Instagram’s support team to see if they can see the reason for why your hashtags aren’t working.I

1. Mayfair is the most effective filter. The researchers found that while #NoFilter is the most used hashtag on Instagram, the Mayfair filter is actually the most successful at encouraging follower interactions. 2. Sunday and Monday are the two best days to post. While Thursday is the day people post the most, Sunday and Monday are the two days where engagement is the highest. So if you want more likes and more followers, post things on Sundays and Mondays with a high number of hashtags. 3. More #hashtags increase engagement from followers We can all probably agree that few things are more annoying than when a #caption #is #literally #nothing #but #hashtags, right? But as it turns out, those kinds of posts do much better in terms of engagement than posts that only have, say, one or two. “Accounts with less than 1,000 followers where a post with 11 hashtags received an average of 77.66 interactions,” the report says. The message: the more hashtags you use, the better. 4. There is no time of day better than any others to post photos. Contrary to what might seem logical, there’s no better time a day to post photos for maximum engagement. In terms of photo posts, Instagram pretty much produces the same levels of engagement around the clock, 24/7. 5. For videos, though, after-hours posts do much better.  The research found that for videos, the data is different. Videos posted after work hours, between 9 p.m. and 8 a.m., by far have the highest number of interactions.

There are 2 very important things to gain followers on Instagram. They are good, quality content and distribution. Good content means that the content is interesting to the audience you are targeting - it has to be valuable to them, about them. You won’t get people to follow you if you post something that doesn’t interest them. So it means that you should look at similar accounts in your niche and see what the successful and unsuccessful ones are doing and see the differences - then apply what works. And distribution - even if you have the best content in the world, it has to be found, so you have to distribute it - it can be with hashtags, shoutouts, engagement groups or powerlikes. But make sure that hashtags are relevant to your content and not spammy ones. Plus don’t use the big shoutouts if you are starting out - the goal is to rank in the top posts and it won’t be possible to rank in the big hashtags for you. And when you use shoutouts, powerlikes or engagement groups - make sure that those accounts have the followers from your target market, otherwise it will be very useless to use, because your content will be shown to the people who follow those pages. And one more thing - consistency. You have keep posting consistently - you might not see the results in the very beginning, but don’t let it discourage you, because it could take some time to warm up, as IG doesn’t want new accounts to start grow like crazy because many could be spam accounts. Or maybe you will start to grow fast right from the beginning.

So you want to get more followers on Instagram. There are tons of tips and tricks on the web telling you to post consistently, post at the right times use the right hashtags, etc. But let’s be honest — these tips are extremely generic and don’t work well, especially if you’ve just started a new account. Hence, I’m going to take this from a beginner’s perspective. Starting from zero. If you’re just starting out, organic growth is nearly impossible. You’ll have to do whatever it takes to get your first thousand followers to kickstart your audience. Let’s dive right in. 1. Join follow for follow groups. Joining follow for follow groups is one of the most underrated strategies you can utilize to grow your Instagram followers rapidly. Followchain, Reddit’s r/Followback, and r/FollowForFollow are some examples of these groups. Follow for follow groups are basically places where you can self-promote your Instagram. Now you might be thinking — the people you follow probably won’t engage much, or at all. Wrong. These groups reinforce the follow for follow strategy. What do I mean by that? These groups connect you with people in your niche who will not only follow back but engage consistently. After all, engagement is the most important metric on Instagram. So you don’t want to be following people randomly. Instead, follow people within your niche to increase your engagement rates. Follow for follow groups allow you to accomplish just that. 2. Follow everyone you know on Instagram. Friends, family, acquaintances, etc. Ask them for their Instagram handle and follow them. People you know tend to follow back and engage more because they want to stay updated on your life. 3. Follow mutuals. Instagram has a feature where mutuals can be easily viewed under a user’s bio. Typically, people are more likely to follow an account that has mutuals compared to someone that has little to none. This is because mutuals is a trust factor. The mutual feature also makes it easier to find an old friend’s Instagram. They are more likely to follow you back as you’ve probably met them in person before. 4. Un-private your Instagram account. Un-privating your Instagram account will increase the reach of your account. If your account is private, hashtags cannot be utilized as your posts wouldn’t appear on the explore page. If you un-private your account, people are able to follow easily. 5. Don’t post too much. Contrary to other people’s advice; you shouldn’t be posting too much. One post per day is more than sufficient. In fact, if you post too much, users will end up unfollowing you or muting your posts which will negatively affect your engagement rate. 6. Have a nice-looking feed. You have to have a decent-looking Instagram feed if you want to attract more people to follow you. Naturally, users are more attracted to following someone with a decent feed rather than someone who spends little to no effort in trying to beautify their feed. Moreover, a well-designed feed will give a lasting impression to someone who visits your page for the first time. 7. Constantly engage. In order to get more followers, you’ll have to show that you actually care about your existing followers. Like and reply to every comment you get, consistently like and comment on other’s posts, reply to every direct message, like posts with hashtags within your niche, and leave positive comments. These are just some steps to take to increase awareness for your Instagram and get more people to engage and follow you. Restrictions Please take note of certain restrictions on Instagram! Do not repetitively follow or direct message or you will be temporarily action blocked. The block can last for an hour, 24 hours, or more which will negatively affect your marketing efforts. Instead of following/direct messaging others repetitively, do them in intervals of 5–10 minutes. Bonus tips Be very meticulous on who you choose to follow (check their niche, engagement, following, etc. first). Constantly check, unfollow, and remove ghost followers to increase your engagement rates. You can do that by downloading apps on the app stores that track this.

And while we're on the subject of excess, don't use enough emojis to make it look like a 6 y/o sticker collection. I did above myself and averaged on about 100 new followers/day.

This is my Instagram notification section. On an average, I am adding 12+ followers daily.  But I am not even posting images daily. Then how? Well, this post isn't about "How to boost your Instagram followers in a day". This is about cross-selling. Cross-selling is important and if you're creating content but you aren't cross-selling, you're losing the game. I sell my LinkedIn on Instagram, I sell my Instagram on Quora, I sell my Quora on LinkedIn. Cross-selling increases sales by making customers buy more than they thought they would. For example, they all are following me after consuming my content on Quora. When they opened Quora, they wanted to consume content from Quora but ended up following (buying extra) me on Instagram as well. It also increases the retention rate and lifetime value of a customer (readers in my case). I'm selling content here. What are you selling? You can find a ton of answers to this but what works the most are Be patient - I mean really patient, Instagram has killed the exposure that artists generally look for, it has become nothing but a pay-per-view kind of platform, so if you want to grow you instagram “organically” you have to put in a lot of effort and sometimes your efforts might not be reciprocated, but keep your head down and enjoy what you are doing, it’s just another social media.Find a niche: Don’t post random stuff on your Instagram page, if you are a model restrict your posts to your modeling, if you’re a photographer, show off your work, but don’t combine 2–3 different profiles into one.Be original: I’ve seen so many people who are just copying each other in the name of “inspiration”, don’t be that person. Be original, even if you’re bad today, eventually you’ll get better, but don’t copy others’ ideas and call it inspiration.Interact with others: As much as most people want likes/followers for themselves, it is imperative that you interact with others too. This way you maintain a relation with other artists which will help your Instagram to grow. Long story short, Be nice to others.Put in the hours: I know it sounds like a full time job, but you have to invest some time each day on Instagram for you to grow, from posting your content, interacting with others’ content, replying to the people who interacted with your content etc., this will take some part of your time daily. So, be prepared to put in the hours.Hope these help :)

response.answer_text: As someone who personally built Instagram accounts with over one million followers, there are a number of ways to tackle this. influencer marketing. if you're trying to build an Instagram account with a specific theme i.e. fitness, health, travel, etc., find relevant influencers within the same field and pay them a fee to sponsor your account. It helps to start with some interest, topic, or hobby that others share with you. Search for that in Instagram and click into the profiles of the search results. If they look like they're worth following, follow them. Look for follower count and click it. This should show their followers. Look at profiles, like posts and follow. Use suggested follows if they're there. Continue to do this. On your own profile, post original pictures and stuff. Eventually you will get follow-backs from some of the people you followed. Notice other people's posts that have a lot of likes and get ideas for your own posts. Post with some bit of regularity. Colorful posts tend to do well. Interesting, engaging, and original content will give people a reason to follow you.

Fill Your Bio Your bio is the prime place where people get to learn about you. So tell about yourself like what you love, your passions, projects or dreams, etc. Be sure to add your full name and your website too. Post Artistic Content There is no replacement for artistic content. If your content is great, people are going to like and comment on your posts. Instagram is all about great visuals. So include vivid colors and frame your photos well. Post at Proper Interims A study conducted showed that consistent posting is key to growing your Instagram outreach. They analyzed over 100,000 Instagram posts for a three-month period. Use the Proper Hashtags The purpose of hashtags is to reach out to an audience that isn’t following you. It’s important to use the right hashtags if you want to get noticed by the right crowd.

Best way to gain followers on Instagram is to work daily at it. Share interesting images or photography that will attract others to like your posts and want to follow your account. Use your imagination when writing about your images you share, such as, information about the photo or a short story that goes along with it. If other Instagramers comment on your post, always thank them for the comment. Being courteous helps and can land you some extra followers along the way. My advice, stay away from purchasing followers on Instagram. Having a large follower number does not guarantee success, in fact… in the long run this way will hinder your account. Most Instagramers are wise to this type of number fluffing and will stay away from such accounts. Plus, these fake followers are usually caught by Instagram as spam and shut down. Learn to market yourself properly and you'll attract followers in time!

The world needs more of that and Instagram is a pretty positive place to begin with.

So you should start using hashtags in your content, but remember, put relevant hashtags on your specific niche.

Want to know how to get followers on Instagram? And how to do it the right way, without shelling out big bucks or engaging in shady tactics? You’ve come to the right place. I noticed a lot of people think Instagram is what you use first to get more followers on Instagram. That might make sense logically, but truthfully, there’s a lot of off platform shit you need to do first that’ll help grow your followers on a platform like Instagram. For example, if nobody knows who you are, nobody writes about you, and you don’t have a presence of any kind off platform, you don’t have any sort of validation that people need in order to make the leap and trust you / follow you / want to invest in you. So you have to figure out who you are and what you’re selling, do the usual marketing and PR thing, and plug and promote your Instagram within that. Once you have a decent following (let’s say 1,000 active fans, but it could honestly be half that), then you can start focusing on all the on platform stuff like managing hashtags, regramming, interacting with more popular accounts, and in some cases, buying shoutouts and ads to promote the account.

DO NOT buy Instagram followers. You may increase your followers in the short term but they will do you no good in the long run. 3 things to do : 1 Post good quality content, i.e. good photos and good captions. 2 Include up to 30 hashtags in your comments. Some people make the mistake of going for the most popular hashtags,which is a mistake. For example if you are in the motivation niche if you use #motivation there are over 131 million posts. That is pointless as there is no chance of being found on the Explore Page. It is better to start with hashtags between 50,000 and 100,000 posts. One example is #motivationiskey with 91,000 posts. 3 Make meaningful comments on popular accounts in your niche. Don’t just write “great post” . Make your comment relevant to the post.
